description: Love this place! Just came to San Fran for the day for the first time and stumbled upon this bar on accident. Cool spot with good drinks and beers (and wine and cocktails) with an open door so you get the glory of the amazing outdoor weather. Having said that, the bartender Justin made it awesome! He's so friendly and gave us tips on places to explore, which is awesome if you're trying to branch out from the typical tourist-y spots. Totally recommend!
author: Katja P.

description:
Im not sure what this guy's name is, but a doorman who works here Sunday morning (10am) continues to come into the bar across the street, The Northstar Cafe, and intentionally tries to to piss off both the Bills and Eagles fans watching their games.

I also love watching games at the boardroom and ordering some wings, but this kind of obnoxious and rude behavior means I'm taking my money elsewhere.
author: Tyler S.

description:
The staff are cool.
Better than average selection on beers on tap.
Crowd is mixed. Unfortunately, you'll see a bunch of North Beach and Marina type bros on big game days. You know, the loud aggro ones who wear sunglasses inside.
That being said, it isn't the place's fault.
author: Dennis W.

description: The Boardroom was the perfect place to post up and enjoy a few hours of Football Sunday. Came to San Francisco for the first time and as much as I wanted to sight see and walk around and do this and that, Football Sunday is Football Sunday, we needed to be somewhere with a big television and crazed fans regardless of what city we were in. Did a quick Sports Bar search on Yelp in the area we happened to be walking around in at that time and this place popped up. This is your classic Sports Bar; mixed crowd both old and young, jerseys, Jameson shots being poured, beers being passed around, wings being eaten, pool being played, Sports Bar. We found two seats at the corner of the bar and grabbed those for a few hours. They had some great beers on tap, local breweries and your usual domestic options. They had your standard bar food, nothing too healthy as can be expected. The bartenders were super laid. back and cool. Very chill vibe in here. The bathroom was definitely gross. I mean, real gross. The sink had a massive massive soap bottle in it so you couldn't access the sink to wash your hands, which meant the zillions of people who went in and out of the bathroom were definitely not washing their hands, which totally skeeved me out. Luckily I had wet ones on me so I could. make do, but also, bleh. Definitely come here on Sunday to watch the game, it definitely seemed like a day drinking place. Fun time.
author: Samantha S.

description:
Came in on a whim from the east bay, which we rarely do. Since we were early we decided to catch the Mexico Korea World Cup soccer game. Great small neighborhood crowd. Inexpensive drinks. Pretentiousness left at the door. Am I in Oakland? Aarón (aka Aaron) was an excellent bartender. Got a bloody and a screwdriver to start the day. Ordered a few other beers after that. What happens next? Justin the owner says he made pozole overnight and offers everyone in the bar complimentary pozole. Yes. Complimentary. Pozole. (See porn food photos attached). This most likely will not happen for you on another day, but I still think the gesture was great. 
Great weather. Great people. Great vibes. Come here n get a drink. I won't miss this spot in the future for any of our big games. I guess SF isn't so bad... :)
author: C T.

description:
This is definitely one of my favorite sports bars in SF. The service is fantastic looking at you Justin and JP. Love y'all. But they have very good nibbles for a sports bar. I've had the tots, poutine, wings, hummus, chicken tenders, and quesadillas; all have been really tasty. Def go with the wings, I love them, Louisiana or buffalo, I like spicy. They have of course ranch or Bleu cheese as dipping sauces for the wings and bring you crema and salsa with the quesadillas. 

They have a great beer menu and full bar. I love that I can have whatever I'm feeling a tequila shot or a nice pour of dechutes fresh squeezed ipa. And the new location is bomb for sure. There are so many TV's that I was able to watch baseball, stanley cup finals, and basketball. Did I mention I love sports? The new place is fantastic, they have many more TV's and a projector for the "big games". I'm trying to get my alum group to meet here instead of where we are currently at; I love this bar that much. Food and drinks and not just beer a full bar! I just wish they served micheladas full time and not just during brunch. 

The service is fantastic and if you are looking for an amazing spot to watch games and have some munchies and drinks this is the place. But shhh... I don't want it to get too popular. Especially now that they have a pool table.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Not a great bar for a night cap. Bartender was rude to my friend and I. She didn't have her ID but he's never ID her then he does. But more it was his attitude. It was my birthday and he wouldn't even let her buy me a shot. She proved she was of age to
Be there but he kept pushing to be dramatic saying that her address didn't say San Francisco on the ID she provided. Cute decor though. Ha pickle back.
author: Netta W.

description:
Tequila, tacos, & trivia! The alliteration! 

I was actively yelping for bars with trivia night and decided to give this one a try due to good reviews on their trivia and bar food! Came on at 8:30 on Tuesday night with a total of five friends for a night of fun and good $2 tacos. 

My first impressions coming in was that it was on a quieter street than I expected after dark. The interior was pretty small, but homey. They had large screen TVs for games behind the bar and two tables for larger parties (5-6 people) in the back. 

The trivia was pretty challenging, especially not knowing what to expect the first time here. There were 6 rounds, which included subjects such as Current Events, Asian Geography, a picture round, song round, and a surprise round. Some of the questions were less catered to our Millenial generation selves (understandable judging from the older crowds that came in). Nevertheless I thought it was pretty fun although we came in last place (womp womp). 

While I was pretty full from dinner prior to coming, their bar food menu was full of enticing comfort snacks such as bacon wrapped tater tots I had to refrain from ordering. I still got a $2 carnitas taco to try. It was actually very flavorful, filled with the savory meat pork and hearty beans. As for drinks, I ended up getting a Mexican Mule (pretty good for $7) that was really refreshing and just strong enough to me. One bartender was working and he did a good job serving drinks to us and the rest of the packed crowd in for trivia. 

I was honestly going to give this place four stars--A litte far for me to come regularly, but it's a small cozy bar that is great for locals. This joint has good bar food, drinks, and snacks. However, it was brought to my attention from one of my friends that I came with that he was rudely (and racist-ly) called out by the bartender for not tipping before he even had a chance to do so. While I didn't directly experience this, I'm disappointed this happened to our group of 5 Asians as a first impression here. We actually all spent a good amount of money on drinks and snacks together here (and do know how to tip), but probably will try another bar as a group because this happened to us.
author: Clarissa C.

description: I thought it would only be right if my first yelp review was written about my favorite bar in San Francisco. Ok - I'm a little biased because It's only a hop, skip and a jump from my apartment, but the up-beat ambiance, multiple high quality TVs, and solid beer selection speaks for itself. All of the bartenders are hardworking and easy to talk to. The addition of the pool table that was lacking from their previous location was monumental. Trivia Tuesday is raunchy yet educational, and the $3 tecates are always cold. Not the best food or beer prices in town, but definitely the best place to watch sports in North Beach. I bring friends and family here and would recommend to just about anyone.
author: Tyler C.

description:
Came out here to watch the Warriors game last night and it was a pretty chill spot.  Nothing fancy, definitely divey and small, but the crowd was chill and the staff was friendly. One big projection screen and several flat screens through out.  Great selection of spirits.  

Monday is their wings night, and at $0.50 a pop, you can't really beat that.  Great sauces.

I would come back on Mondays for the wings.
author: Veasna H.

description: How the hell are we supposed to call in a pick up order if your phone is not working. Call it. And fix it and then answer the damn thing. # 1 rule of business man answer the Damn phone!
author: Bryan H.

description: Here's your business model in SF. Move across the street to get rid of the rodents, charge more for drinks, and hire bartenders who are complete Richards to your clientele. Seriously wtf ownership? I understand that serving drunks in north beach is a pain in the ass, but don't treat locals like idiots.
author: Mitchell M.

description:
Wow.

This spot came out of nowhere and really surprised me.

It doesn't look like much.  Looks just like another random sports bar.  But when I got my bill for drinks, they were charging $2 pints and shots during happy hour.  I was like this can't be right but it was.

Then came the food.  We ordered totchos (a personal fave), wings, rings, and poutine.  What kinda bar has both totchos and poutine?!  Just amazing. Everything came out quickly and exceeded my expectations.  

Definitely give this place a try if you're in the area!
author: Hansen L.

description: We came here for trivia on a Tuesday, and we had a positive experience overall. The drinks selection was great, the food was great and the staff was friendly. What brings my rating down was the atmosphere. It felt very cold and uninviting - I dont think you would want to bring a date here. Maybe a change in the lighting or paint colors or decor would improve it. Also the pool table had a horrible lean on it, making it impossible to spend any more money playing on it.
author: Simone B.

description: The Boardroom opened early for the World Cup and was equipped to cater to the early morning crew eager to watch. The new location is full of light on a sunny day and had loads of great beer on tap. I was so surprised at the wonderful food! I highly recommend the Boardroom for good drinks, good food, friendly staff, plenty of TVs and even a pool table.
author: Margie H.

description:
I don't even know where to start. I came out tonight for a fun game of trivia but instead, I had a bartender named MATT ask me how long I've been in this country (because I am asian?).. After paying for my food, he asked me "how long have you been in this country?" I responded, "I've lived here all my life." He responded, "Well, do you know what it means to tip???" I literally did not even have 5 seconds to pull out my wallet and tip him as he proceeded to embarrass me in front of everyone I responded, "I'm sorry if I offended you, here's a 18% tip." '

I don't mind if you asked if I forgot to tip, but the ridiculous impatience and the fact that you questioned if I'm even from here is what makes it so disrespectful...

I honestly do not know what triggered this, but I want to give the benefit of the doubt that this place has more potential and that you are probably a nice and not a racist person (highly unlikely), but your attitude did not reflect that. Thank you but I am sincerely sorry about this review.
author: Jeremie A.

description: This location must have moved across the street.  When we got there today the original location was boarded up.  The menu was simply fried bar food - nothing like what was described by they reviews here.  We were completely disappointed and left.
author: Rosie B.

description:
This place is a gem!

I moved to San Francisco from St. Louis. And St. Louis, for those who don't know, is home of some of the best bar food. 

One of my favorite bar foods is obviously the TOTCHO. Unfortunately, I've only found a couple of places in the city that do a solid job with the Totcho. My friend, knowing that I love Totchos, sent a link to The Boardroom to me, and we went the next day.

This place is great. It's a total hole in the wall dive bar stocked with a great beer selection, and of course, Totchos. The Totchos have real cheese, fresh pico, sour cream, and the works! They're baked and awesome. 

Whether you're having a good day, bad day, or if it's generally any day, hit up The Boardroom and get yourself a Totcho.
author: Katie R.

description:
Decided to check this place out for trivia on 6/5/18 because of Taco Tuesday, tequila and beer specials. Unfortunately they offered no tacos or specials. They said they weren't offering it anymore because they changed locations.  So I wouldn't rely upon the information on their website. 

On the positive side the staff was very nice. We liked the trivia host and the trivia was challenging and fun. Good selection of beers on tap. We tried a number of items on the menu, our favorites were the buffalo wings and pretzels.  Service was fast and friendly.
author: L C.

description:
Yesterday, I found myself stumbling upon this place randomly. I came with a friend and we had a couple drinks. What a fucking awesome night! :)
Oh, drinks were good, lol. Yeahhh.
author: James N.

description: Good atmosphere for a Warriors game. Bartenders were fast and on point. Didn't try the food but everything looked good. They would cut the audio off for the commercials during the game and play music which I thought was unique, I've never been to a bar that did that and it added to the atmosphere.
author: Aarón D.

description: Picked up some chicken tenders and nachos. The tenders were great. Not super impressed by the nachos, but they weren't bad by any means. Unfortuantely I couldn't stay but the place looked chill and the bartenders were friendly. I'll definitely go back to check it out further
author: Lyndon G.

description:
I can't believe I never been here??

Home of the bacon wrapped tater tots

divey sports bar but with great food, drinks and vibe

Clean

Plenty of seating and TVs for sport games

Came here for brunch and their menu is awesome

Loco moco -$11. Looked good! 

Hangover burger - omg u must get it. Burger with Tater tot patty, egg, bacon on a soft bun?!! So good. Juicy and worth every dollar and fat-$9

Who needs to spend over $15 for a burger (ahem causewells)

Bacon wrapped tots - must get. Crunchy and salty. I'm still thinking about them

Pitcher of mimosas and it's a fabulous day

Tip- order everything at the bar and they will serve you.  Great service!

Will defintely come back here
author: Carol Y.

description: Good place to park your sports crazed man. If he chooses the boardroom over you for brunch, you don't have to dump him. He's just passionate. And no woman should feel insecure about having a man on their leash 24/7. That's an un-woman. Drop him off at the boardroom, preferably after brunch, then go to your favorite dive and hang with the boys or girls or yourself ;-) The Boardroom is hands down the best day care center for men A+. lots of adrenaline there too if you're into it
author: Juls C.

description: The wings are great. The prices even better. Really cool hang out after work to relax and chill.
author: Sil N.

description: Good friendly service, low key sports bar vibe, and omg the bacon taters are delish. I kind of regret eating so many of them tho but oh well, #foodcation!
author: Ashley C.

description:
I come to this place every Monday for $0.50 wing day. If I am missing a Monday its because someone in my family died (would have to be my father or mother, possibly my brother).

With a Happy hour from 4-7pm offering $2 off any draft, pairing with some chicken wings you cant go wrong. They have around 8+ flavors, including spicy versions of certain sauces (recommend the Spicy Island wings since its a very unique and delicious flavor). On top of all this, there are 4 TV's and a Projector so you wont miss any major sports going on.

In other news, the burgers are solid but nothing spectacular. Do not get their wine that is on tap, if you need a reason as to why then you deserve a glass of said wine.
author: Joseph Rebelo R.

description:
I don't know how I haven't left a review for this place yet. Ive been coming here for over a decade. Even after I moved out of the city, I always make sure to stop here for a couple drinks when I'm in town.  In addition to a great atmosphere and a great location, they have plenty of options for sports on multiple TVs. Also, their bar food is absolutely delicious and very well presented. You'd never expect such great quality food to come from a bar, but these guys knock it out of the park.  The staff and owner are phenomenal, very down to earth people that take pride in the bar as well as their regulars and newcomers alike. 

Make sure to make a stop by the boardroom, you wont be disappointed.
author: Brett D.

description: Came in for "a drink" around 3pm.....left at 10pm. Had such an awesome time we completely cancelled dinner plans! Food was soooo good we shared appetizers and they were all amazing! Drinks were awesome, service was exceptional. Justin and Matt definitely made us feel welcome. We can't wait to visit again all the way from San Diego!
author: Hillary G.

description:
Yes yes yes! This dive bar had everything I love all in one place. 

Sports on TV - check 
A good choice of beers - check 
Six varieties of wings - check times six 

We visited here as part of a whistle stop your of San Fran and as part of this tour we went to one of the most luxurious hotels in the city and a swinging jazz bar but there's something about the laid back relaxed feeling to a dive bar that I just can't get enough of! Oh and did I mention they had six varieties of wings, each as tasty as the next. There wings were the sort that make you real messy. You know when you pick one up and you have to get it in to your mouth quickly before sauce drops off on to your shirt and accompanied you for the rest of your evening? They came served in simple red baskets and grease proof paper, simple but sublime! 

The atmosphere was good but you could tell there were a few locals in just to enjoy the sport but as mentioned they didn't seem too bothered when a group of us pulled up a perch at the end of the bar, not that we made too much noise, we were busy eating wings. 

I wish I had of taken note of the beer I was drinking, I know it was a draught IPA but it was delicious - so just ask the bar man for that. 

All in all a great experience, one that I wished could have lasted longer! Easy four stars, maybe even close to five!
author: Stevie M.

description:
If there's one area that locals avoid, it's North Beach. It's a pain in the ass to get to, it's infested with tourists, parking is beyond atrocious, and valet can costs as much as 3 boozy cocktails. 

When it comes to parking, I'm going to practice my rare, frugality methods. Shoot, I'm not going to waste money on valet parking that can be used for romancing the bottle. Yep, priorities. 

Tater Tot had his first grooming appointment in North Beach so we begrudgingly headed there on a Friday afternoon. The parking gods must have been looking over us because I scored awesome metered parking on Columbus street. We had 2 hours to kill after dropping him off so I thought I knock off some of my North Beach bookmarks that were collecting dust.

First up: The Boardroom. 

I love that it's a scotch off the beaten path of touristy Columbus Avenue. And, unless the tourist is a Yelper, they're probably unlikely to find The Boardroom. 

I was hoping to be welcomed by the resident pooch that I've seen on Yelp pics but sadly, he wasn't there. It's ok though because we were welcomed by our super nice bartender who had a very distinctive Vin Diesel voice. 

The Boardroom is a dive bar that serves decently priced drinks, bar food, and brunch on the weekends (hello, cookie batter French toast!). There's a bunch of flat screen TVs for watching the game and a Rockbot so you can select whatever song you want to play ($1/song). 

Fridays are the best day of the week because I can drink to my heart's content and not have to worry about having to wake up at ass crack of dawn to go to work. The Boardroom has happy hour specials Monday- Friday 4 pm - 7 pm: $1 off all wells, beers, and shot specials, $6 fernet and tecate, and $5 nachos. On Mondays, they have 50 cent wings (I'll make it there one day!) and Tuesdays are $2 tacos and trivia night. CC's accepted. 

I stuck with usual Hendrick's Tonic ($10) which was nicely stiff. I noticed they carried Effen Vodka which is rare so I also had two Effen Black Cherry Tonics ($9 each).

What's booze without some good drunchies right?

We ordered their infamous Bac-o-Tots ($8): http://bit.ly/1dKsqJn and Carne Asada Nachos (Small - $7): http://bit.ly/1IkLF48 which were great. You can never go wrong with bacon and tots but together, they make the perfect drunchies snack especially with the side of ranch for dipping. Yep, definitely get an order of these...for yourself. We regretted not ordering a large nachos because they was pretty good as well. Fresh mound of crunchy chips topped with a duo of melty cheese, black beans, tender bits of carne asada, salsa rojo, guac, jalapenos, and crema. The chef brought out our food to us himself which I thought was a nice touch. 

Didn't encounter any douches when we were there like others did but there may be a resolution for that. Blast some Justin Bieber, Miley Cyrus or Ariana Frappuccino Grande on the Rockbot. Problem solved.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: For the prices they should have working restrooms and locking bathroom doors. Customer service there is ok but again for the price and location I guess I expect more. There are so many other places to go downtown and I guess if rather go some place else.
author: Roxy L.

description: Great dive bar with great food hidden off main streets in North Beach neighborhood. Strolled in on a Sunday night to watch the Seahawks game and found nice service, some seating and nice fellow customers. Bar tender was nice enough to recommend ordering only one burger to split between me and my boyfriend as well as two apps. Food was delicious - can't wait to go try something else next time! Plenty of beer to choose from. Only thing is bar is pretty small and seating is kinda funky around TVs but other than that service and quality of food and drinks are 5/5.
author: Casey P.

description:
Came by here on Tuesday evening for the trivia night with some friends and had a jolly good time! The tap selection is decent, but nothing to write home about. As an aside, they have a 15 dollar minimum if you use a credit card. 

However, the carnitas tacos that are on special on Tuesday nights for 2 bucks a piece are fantastic. They're relatively small, so you'll want to order a few, but they have a light, juicy flavor that's hard to beat for the price. 

The trivia night itself is fun, and I'd recommend it. It is a sports bar, so be ready to have a round dedicated to a sport or team. There also isn't a team size limit as far as I could tell, so feel free to bring any number of your friends along.
author: Chet A.

description:
I randomly picked a bar on a map in a neighborhood we hadn't visited yet - and The Boardroom was it! I was pretty thrilled with my random choice. We sat right at the bar and were served right away. It's a nice divey sports bar - divey in all the right places. They don't take themselves too seriously. They had an abundance of TVs with a vareity of games. A HUGE selection of booze and the food looked good. We didn't order any, just drank, but we oggled other folks foods and it did look tasty. 

While we didn't make it back here - we intended to, since this place seemed right up our alley.
author: Jessie C.

description: On the Saturday night Super Bowl City reached max capacity, my friend and I decided to look up local sports bars to watch the Warriors game. Luckily, thanks to Yelp, and trying to brave another bar that was over its capacity, we found The Boardroom! It wasn't too busy and there were plenty of TV's in every part of the place. We ordered chicken tenders which were quite pricy, but wasn't bad! Great atmosphere, clean, and nice service. Lots of screens to watch sports games!
author: Sarina J.

description: Had a fantastic time at this great local bar!  We are Iowa State fans and had the opportunity to watch Saturday's game with lots of ISU alumni at The Boardroom.  This is the "home bar" for ISU, TCU and Clemson so a very lively crowd for the ISU vs TCU game on Saturday.  Even better to see ISU win!!  Great crowd!  Great bartenders!  The food also looked great, but we didn't get to try.  Next time!
author: Melanie G.

description:
omg 1st time yesterday at boardroom the cook was hot a gangster cook omg this white girl wants that i ordered food and he brought it out to me nice sexy deep voice plus food was very good chicken sandwhich was good any body know when he working again short bald hot hot latino.  the bartender was cool matt i think.his name was will be coming bk very soon 

love ks
from kansas city
author: Katy S.

description:
I have mixed emotions about The Boardroom. On the one hand, it's in North Beach, a place I love, the staff is incredibly kind, they play great music, and have lots of big TVs for ample sports viewing. 

On the other hand, it smells like my college boyfriend's shared dorm apartment, ie, dirty towels and bong water, trivia night was a huge bust as the hostess was absolutley schwaaasted (like blurting out answers to trivia questions and heckling some guys in the crowd), the place is very tiny and dark, and last but not least (and at no fault of the establishment) we were infultrated by the *biggest douchebags* I have encountered in a while - seriously, they ate the better part our nachos and bacon mac n' cheese and got really angry when we told them to stop and moved our food away.

Me and the girlies started off the day yesterday in high spirits, looking forward to Dr Teeth's Tuesday Trivia / Two-for-One Maragarita deal / Two Dolla Taco fest, only to have our dreams squashed roadside after we learned that *Dr Teeth NO LONGER DOES TRIVIA* (fyi, y'all). So we had to resort to other options. Boardroom is somewhere between all of our offices, so we landed there. 

Rita I and I got there waaaay before the trivia rush and planted ourselves at one of the two long tables and filled ourselves with a Margarita and a Corona ($5 each) and waited for our homegirls to grace us with their presence. I had the Fernet and Tecate deal for $6 which was pretty sweet.

Now kiddies, I welcome you to flashforward a few hours to almost trivia time. We were joined by some random menfolk from Canada who made a good impression - at first. Then they proceeded to take and eat our food and tried to justify it. Um, I hate you. Thankfully the staff saw what was happening and took the charge off our bill and put it onto theirs. The chef in the kitchen does major work - cooking and bringing everything out to the many people who order, good work!

We shared Nachos with Carne Asada ($9) which was pretty bomb, plus an order of Mac N' Cheese with Bacon ($8) which was no bueno. It was basically large elbow pasta with a watery cheese sauce and topped with nearly burned bacon bits. Sad face central. Stephanie S got the Bacon Wrapped Tater Tots aka Bac-o-Tots ($8 for five) which she said were yummy, but not a lot came in an order. Rita I had the Buffalo Wings in Island Flavor ($9), which were not particularly meaty, but had good flavor. During trivia we got all fat kid and ordered Tot-chos ($8) and they were OK, a combo of soggy and then dried out, I could probably live without them.

Anywho, I'd like to go back and try brunch. I think last night was also slightly tainted because there was a Wild Card A's v. Royals game on that went to the 12th inning, and there were way too many A's fans clogging up the joint. So that's that: I hope to be back, I hope no more awful men approach me and my friends, and I hope the staff continues to rock on.
author: Crystal C.

description:
For those of you who don't like waiting in a long drink line at the North Star, The Boardroom is a fine North Beach alternative.

This is pretty much a neighborhood watering hole. Not too large. Mostly locals frequent the joint. I highly doubt that folks would traverse the city to come here. But once you're here, you're pretty much treated like family by the bar-keeps.

We came in here on last Saturday night after a comedy show.  We had no problems saddling up at the bar and ordering a few pops. Service was friendly. The whiskey pours were generous. The drink prices were reasonable. And the mood was lively. What more do you want from a neighborhood bar. 

Apparently, they also host a fun trivia night every Tuesdays. I'd definitely come back!
author: Kevin B.

description:
Looking for a dive bar in the city that locals frequent and the tourist don't wander into? Then The Boardroom is your place to go!

This place is a dive, but you can get bacon wrapped tater tots, WHAT?  BACON on potato action, hell yea! They were good, not mind blowing but good, its bacon how can you go wrong.

Couple of TVs on the wall to catch some games, nice seating area, looks like it could get packed, was there on a Sunday afternoon and it was 50% full.

Blue Moon on tap and that's what I drank.  Restrooms are a hot mess, do go, HOLD IT!

Took some pics, shared a laugh or two, so good times happened in this place.
author: Monica O.

description:
The food is so delicious, the western bacon burger was huge and so good. Toasted bun with good cheddar cheese and the pulled pork is real good and has a little spice to it. The drinks were priced right and the customer service was on point. If looking for a bar with good food then definitely check out this place. 

It's a little small but the atmosphere and ambiance is real chill. Good food and quality drinks
author: Candice L.

description: Fun, local North Beach bar! Great to watch a ball game and have great bar food. Everyone is so friendly. Come and have a good time.
author: Lynnet S.

description:
I came here on a Tuesday night with a friend for trivia. We expected the place to be packed so we got there 30 min early. Turns out only about 10 people including us showed up for trivia. Regardless, we still had a great time and the trivia was really fun but would've been better with more people. 

They did, however, have $2 tacos which were super delicious so I was a happy camper. Also took my first shot of Fernet here which was interesting to say the least. 

Curious to try the other food there. I'm sure I'll be back!
author: Ilana B.

description:
I love a good dive bar and this is actually a really good one. We stopped in for one drink and also got a selection of wings and bacon wrapped tater tots. Yes, that's a thing. The food was great - really tasty, saucy wings with a really nice dip and I loved the tater tots. 

They have a few screens showing sports, only one toilet and a cash/Atm machine. Staff were friendly and is definitely head here again if I was in the area.
author: Briony C.

description:
Yay! I'm a fan.  Here are 5 reasons why I give two thumbs up to The Boardroom:

1.  The Boardroom is an Arizona State University bar! Fork 'em, Devils! The NorCal ASU alums congregate here for games
2.  Bacon-wrapped tater tots are amazing
3.  This little dive bar is cozy and has a great neighborhood feel! 
4.  You can get poutine here! 
5.  The regulars are friendly and the management is too!  There is good company here
author: Andrea H.

description: Awesome drink specials for happy hour. Awesome bar tending super chill guy. Totally recommend to anyone to come in and grab a drink.
author: Shane C.

description:
Everyone has their favorite bar.  This is my favorite in SF.

Why, you ask?  Reasonably priced drinks - particularly at Happy Hour. ($4 pints - some good stuff on tap)  They introduced me to Frenet.  Excellent service.  The bartenders are super cool and take the time to get to know their customers.  The patrons are always interesting - Definitely the 25-40 (mostly male), affluent/professional but not flashy set.  There are plenty of the fratty types, but I have yet to see the obnoxious variety (I'm looking at you, Wreck Room ;) )  I've had a lot of good conversations with folks while grabbing a few pints and watching games.  Generally, there are some gals there too.  It's a good sports scene.  I go for MNF and hockey games.  One of the bartenders is a Leafs fan.  Overall, it's a relaxing place to unwind and grab a few drinks with buddies, and a good place to pop in by yourself.

And, the food.  I love tater-tots!  They've got'em.  The sandwiches are all good - I'm a big fan of their burger ($10 if you get it with Cheddar and Bacon, with a side of tots).  I've tried the Pulled Pork, and that was also terrific.  They do Bacon-Wrapped Tater-Tots, which was actually how I found out about the joint.  Yes, they're great!  Also, for Happy Hour they do $4 tots and nachos (and, I believe they make their own chips - they're good.)  

I won't hold the fact that it's an ASU bar against them  ;)
author: Adam S.

description:
I had my eye on this place because I heard about the bacon-wrapped tater tots. Soon as I got there, I placed my order. The service was surprisingly fantastic for a crowded dive bar. The bartender came right to us and kept an eye on us all night. (Caution: we were white males). 

The totchos looked and smelt like the belly of the most beautiful pig on the planet. Honestly though, they weren't as incredible as I imagined them to be. I thought they would be seasoned or done up in some way, but they actually tasted like something a kid brother would make at 2am, but cost 8 dollars more (it also hurt my heart a little bit to pay 8 bucks for 12 tater tots.. bacon or not). 

The saving grace, however, was the corned beef sandwich. That sandwich gave me liiiiife! Nearly perfectly cooked meat, with just the right amount of coleslaw to compliment it's flavor. Bread: nice and fluffy. And a nice bowl of broth to dip in. Simply succulent. 

Great service, average bacon wrapped tater tots, and a fantastic corned beef sandwich at a bar in North Beach....

STRONG 4-star
author: Jeff S.

description: Great sports bar with really really great Moscow Mules.  Pretty good bar food as well.  Perfect for watching a sports event.
author: Susan C.

description:
Four words sums this place

bacon wrapped tater tot 

Justin is a awesome bartender that know how to serve a shot and a beer!!!
author: B C.

description:
What a pleasant football Sunday we had because of the boardroom!

The TVs aren't the biggest, but there are enough of them all around this cozy bar to make every seat front row. 

The bartender was very attentive, and never left us with a dry glass. The food was plentiful, basic and tasty. I strongly suggest the biscuits and gravy, but would not frown on the moco loco either. Their buffalo chicken tenders hit the spot for our second round, but the most impressive we're the nachos and the BACON WRAPPED TATER TOTS!

The crowd was excellent, a mix of all ages appropriate for a bar. There were pats, Vikings, skins, Seahawks, and of course 9'ers fans. Everyone had actress time cheering for their respective teams in this highly inclusive environment. 

My only gripe is in regards to the pitcher of mimosas. The bottom line is that idea needs to be reworked in a way that is tastier. (Most likely a bit more OJ is in order)
author: Greg F.

description:
My favorite place in all of San Francisco!
When I go to SF to visit, I always make sure to stop by here!

You can get a dirty hipster (jameson shot + PBR) and bacon wrapped tater tots all in one spot, whats not to love??
PLUS!! They make a killer bloody mary. One of the best ones I have ever had!!
author: C P.

description:
Was visiting San Fran for the weekend and ended up following a few guys there after Columbus Cafe ( another cools spot).
They suggested we check this place out and a friend and I followed. :) 
The people there were awesome and everybody looked like they just wanted to have a good time. Glad I joined! :)
Oh yea and the tater tots went awesome with my beer.. Cheers!
author: Linette P.

description:
Great place to catch a game or go there for TACO TUESDAY!! At night time it feels like a very normal bar in North Beach.

The drinks are a great price.
author: Kunal T.

description: Great place for a quick drink or to watch the games.  Love the Group -- specially MATT BABNIS.  Runs a great bar scene.  Takes great care of his customers and his community.  One of my fav places.
author: Sheila B.

description: Matt the bartender was amazing- he was friendly and really made our friends feels welcome/ in addition, he makes very good margaritas!- the atmosphere was perfect as well and the food ( mac&cheese, and the nachos) was very good!
author: Kaman R.

description:
Place is sooooo good!!! The Bacon wrapped tator tots are seriously the best thing ever!! Bartender is really good as well. I would give more then 5 stars if possible! 
Drinks are always really good, and all the food is delicious!!!
author: Robert H.

description: Try the bacon wrapped tater tots!  I am not sure they are '$9 good' but it is bacon and tater tots, you really can't go wrong.  The Boardroom was a typical dive, order at the bar and disgusting bathrooms, but it was fabulous to get away from all the tourists!!  We each had a cold beer, wolfed down some bacon wrapped tots, then decided it was time to move onto the next watering hole.
author: Lisa E.

description: Ok I have to admit the bartender made some of the best Moscow Mules....My disappointment with the place was that I order honey bbq wings. They were not fresh at all. Tasted like they were cooked earlier and put in the microwave and warmed up. If I go back in will definitely not order food again.
author: Koby G.

description:
Needed a place for food and mimosas since we were super hungry after a successful night out.  So...bacon-wrapped tater tots?  SIGN ME UP THEN PLZ.  Surprisingly very good for a weekend brunch, especially given the dive bar nature of the place.  

Surprisingly though, a very good brunch.  I would've never thought that a beef brisket with poached eggs to be so good at a place like this.  But they said the beef just came in that day, and it was fresh as hell.  Gave it a shot...man I was not disappointed.  That brisket was flavored very well, and the broth was quite tasty.

Must also mention how friendly our bartender was, made our stay that much more enjoyable!  Definitely worth coming back here for sure.
author: Alexander Y.

description:
Reading the previous reviews, we must have hit The Boardroom on a bad day.  We asked a local for a good, off-the-beaten path place for lunch, and The Boardroom was recommended.
First of all, the music, a mix of hip-hop and rap, was way too loud.  
My husband ordered a beer, and the bartendress (lady bartender) put a head on it that rivaled Don King's hair.  When he asked her to top it off, her attitude was almost as hefty.
Now, I know that it's a bar, and most bars aren't known for their fine wine, but the stuff that they poured me rivaled Uncle Jesse's 30 year old grape experiment, and not in a good way.
I ordered a taco salad, which was supposed to arrive with a plethora of tasty ingredients.  However, it was merely tortilla chips, lettuce, salsa, and jalapeños.  No cheese, sour cream or guacamole.  Boo.
My husband got a veggie burger with sweet potato fries and stated that he liked his meal.
So we came, we sat, we tried.  Had to be an off day.
author: Robin C.

description:
Bacon. Wrapped. Tater. Tots.

My two favorite things on one yummy plate. The tots were perfect: crunchy outside, hot mealy center, and the bacon was perfectly crispy.

The service was great, the drinks were reasonable. But the tots were so good my feet tingled any my legs went numb. In a good way.

GO. That's all I can say.
author: Jamie C.

description:
Post-Awesome 80s 5K (http://www.yelp.com/biz/awesome-80s-run-san-francisco#hrid:1utkwLbIxRyRkSfJKYsK6A), we arrived in North Beach a bit early for our brunch reservation at Trattoria Contadina (http://www.yelp.com/biz/trattoria-contadina-san-francisco). 

After parking, I quickly searched "bloody marys" on my yelp app and this place popped up. There just so happened to be four stools available at the bar and the bartender whipped up some delicious, perfect-amount-of-spice, bloody marys. 

We almost canceled our brunch reservation elsewhere when we spotted some of the delicious food offerings being served around us. I'm glad we didn't because our brunch at Trattoria Contadina was incredible. However, I am bookmarking this place for another visit so we can try the food. Mostly because...tater tots!
author: Emily J.

description:
A sports bar! For sports fans! With damn good food! 

As B C. says in another review: "bacon wrapped tater tot" sums it up very well.

I come here for my old college's game days. It's always wall to wall packed at that time, and it's always a great experience (if you wear the correct t-shirt color!)

One star off for the bearded bartender who is unnecessarily rude to anyone who asks a question. I witnessed it happen probably five times in an hour. I see you bro, maybe don't take your bad day out on us?
author: Zach M.

description:
I have fond memories of the Boardroom. It was where I had my last round of drinks pre-sobriety (darn you medicine!). It was one of many places I went post-sobriety. It was where I was thoroughly entertained by witnessing a cute (girl) bartender hitting on my cute (male) colleague...while my other colleague and I pointed out all her moves. In another language, of course. We have some decency...well, not really. Bartender probably knew...but colleague didn't until we pointed it out!

Found myself stumbling back here the other day...and they have bacon-wrapped tater tots. That's right. Bacon makes everything better, and they have made the tater tot into something amazing. AMAZING. We were also tempted by the hot wings...which had the scent, but didn't taste as good as we'd like. It has a good crisp and flavor, but...it was JUST this side of dry. Boo.

Current bartenders here are very friendly and attentive. Is a very comfortable place to hang out!
author: Lily W.

description:
Came here with the BF and his sister when I got a hankering for some burgers- this place came up and was nearby, so off we went. Was told upfront that it was a bar that serves food rather than a burger place, specifically. Good thing too, because when we arrived there was only bar seating and we hesitated at first, thinking maybe we would not be able to eat here.

Luckily, we stayed- probably because the game was on and we didn't want to waste time finding a new spot, but the fact that wings were on special really helped, too.  Fifty cent wings on Mondays, 5pm-10pm.

We ordered a round of beers (had the hawaiian one on draft- can't remember the name, but it was light and sweet, refreshing) and a ton of food: a burger and the brisket dip to share, with sides of bac-o-tots and onion rings, plus (what amounted to) 25 wings in spicy bbq, hot, and spicy island. More on those in a minute.

Burger was just okay, dip sandwich was dry and tough and we did not finish it- very unusual for us. Bac o tots were awesome, but seemed overrated based on other reviews we read here. Onion rings were okay. 
The WINGS are where it's at though- specifically the SPICY ISLAND. I could bathe myself in that sauce. It was phenomenal- I was expecting something with pineapple that's overly sweet and not usually my thing, but this one.. dude, I can't even figure out what was in it! A fresh green herb/spice was present, possibly basil? Or maybe thai basil? Overall the taste to me was more thai than island, but whatever the hell you want to call it, we ordered extras of it, and even then I was dipping my pieces in the extra sauce puddled at the bottom of our basket.

Service was good- bartender/server clearly enjoys his job and was making conversation with most at the bar. Made good food/drink recommendations. Space itself is divey, and that's okay- all the TVs were working and the food was good, so that's all that matters. 
Definitely want to add that the unisex bathroom was surprisingly VERY clean, which I almost didn't expect based on the looks of this place- but the appearance is deceiving. Most dive bars have mediocre foods and questionable cleanliness- and you'll find the exact opposite here: phenomenal island wings and tidy space, from the bathroom to the bartop.
author: Stefany V.

description:
"Were famous for our Bacon Tater Tots!" read their window. Good enough to reel me and my friends in as we drove by. 

Boardroom was a solid stop for a mini pub crawl. Small and intimate enough to get a drink, touristy enough to not be a dive, enough locals for street cred in the touristy North Beach area, and recession buster happy hour prices to make a solid neighborhood joint. You could probably overrun this joint if you had a big enough group. 

Came on a Monday night where the .50 cent chicken wings was the eat of choice and $4 dollar taps were the drink of choice. 

A local enough tap to get a taste of SF beers. My White Lightning was brewed in the Bayview dist. It was then replaced by a Watermelon wheat brewed by 21st Amendment out in the SOMA. Both washed down the pub grub nicely. 

* BAC-O-TOTS -12 for $8. Perfectly crispy. They were probably Ore-Ida tots but damm these were good. Made great fat snacks.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mi8ADETT7WJfssSTld7OmA?select=ilTj8Y_SWoQT8bbzPCdnVg)

- Their unique brunch meny maybe worth trying if you get tired of waiting at Mama's up the block.    

- Their Tuesday Trivia night w/ tacos and Tecates for $2 would be welcome  in my neighborhood.
author: Earl G.

description:
So I came here for a Grouper.  If you're wondering what that is, just look it up.  LOL!

The vibe was actually great for the Grouper.  We got a table in the back and ordered drinks and some snacks.  The servers/bartenders were awesome and it was a great place to have a conversation.  It wasn't too loud and i never felt like I had to shout to be heard.  My only regret is I never tried the bacon wrapped tots!  Next time?
author: Elena N.

description:
Four words: taco tequila trivia Tuesday. 
Four more: bacon-wrapped tater tots. 

I'm such a fan of this place. It's perfectly divey without making you feel like you're going to catch something. It's packed with all kinds of locals on Tuesday nights. Great brunch food - I had some of the best breakfast tacos I've found in the city, and they had all the games on various TV screens. I also tried their secret sweet tea concoction, which was just okay. It tastes like fake bottled tea, but Texas girl was hoping for proper southern sweet tea. Whatever. This is a place to get a cheap beer and shout at the football players on TV, not to drink fancy cocktails. Will definitely be back.
author: Allison P.

description: Can't wait to spend the next basketball game at Columbus Cafe where they actually honor their happy hour specials. This place blows. Bathroom is disgusting too. Lost a customer who lives in the neighborhood for life, so that sucks for them and everyone I am going to tell about it. Also, the bartenders are jerks and need to learn a little customer service.
author: Lauren O.

description:
Bacon wrapped tater-tots.

I could go on and on about the incredibly friendly service, the relaxed environment, the fair-to-good beer selection and the preponderance of televised sporting events.

I could tell you about the fairly good food, and the likelihood that when you randomly stumble into this bar while looking for somewhere after a midday Giants game to catch a beer, that no fewer than three regulars will direct you to the best place to have dinner nearby.

And it's likely that when you come back to San Francisco a year later on business, that three people from your office will demand you take them here because you haven't shut up about this place for the previous two weeks after you found out you were coming to SF.

But let's be honest, you stopped reading at bacon wrapped tater-tots and I bet you're on your way there already.
author: Danny P.

description:
The specials are worth it alone. Wing Monday is my favorite by far - most wing nights sacrifice quality for price, not here! You get em both and only 50 cents.

Smaller bar but overall good vibes
author: Kyle C.

description: Cool neighborhood sports bar. Was on vacation and was able to watch NFL games and drink good beer.
author: Graham S.

description: Bacon wrapped tater tots. Duuuuuuuude... So freakin good. My boyfriend and I ordered chips with salsa and guac, wings, and the bacon wrapped tater tots. We enjoyed the wings and tots, but can pass on the chips next time. We also ordered a few drinks, there was a special on Jameson and pbr? I can't recall the name. But my boyfriend had that, and I just had a Jamie Coke. It's a pretty clean bar, plenty of seating at the bar, with a few big tables around. I don't mind sharing tables, and everyone seemed pretty friendly around here. Overall, I would come back. Most likely during games.
author: Pauline E.

description:
THE BURGER
(3 stars)

So, I've been to The Boardroom and had their tator tots there and they were delicious. I was happy to see them participate at the Ft. Mason Burger Brawl but was kind of disappointed in the food. The tator tots were not what I recall. Their burger looked pretty plain but something about the patty was pretty tasty, what killed it though... the bread - it was dry as hell. 

Will I be back? I'd skip them next time at the Burger Brawl and would rather to go their bar to eat.
author: Jane A.

description: Good atmosphere and cool vibe. Best totchos in town. The beer selection is average but the happy hour is a great deal at $4 per beer in north beach.
author: James K.

description: Great neighborhood bar....staggering distance from home (!).  Have to try the bacon wrapped tater tots...but also good are the burgers, chicken tenders, and Sunday Brunch (w/mimosa pitchers for $14,  Cake Batter French toast, Hawaiian Loco Moco, and Croque Madame sandwiches).
author: Mitzi A.

description:
Cozy little bar and good atmosphere. Watched a GSW warriors game here and had a good time. Bar food was pretty good too. 

Beer was reasonably priced and service was pretty good. 

I'm a fan.
author: Steven Z.

description:
I'll give the bar itself 4 stars, but if I was rating the clientele, they'd get a big FAT 1 star. Talk about a Sausage Fest. And not the good kind of Sausage Fest, ladies! All the worst kind of douchey sausages that you could never want to meet. I truly hope that we had an off experience last night when we went to trivia because I feel sorry for the Boardroom staff if that is what their normal patrons are like. I'll probably only go back if I feel like it's a good night to get constantly harassed.

BUT the bar. The most important part of the review. The people working there are great. Nice people. But there were no waiters, so be prepared to go to the bar to order. The food, for the most part, was good bar food. Bacon wrapped tater tots: Delicious (though few in quantity. Not shareable, in my humble, bacon-loving opinion). Tacos: Yum Yum. Nachos: Great. Mac 'n Cheese: Not great. Just avoid it. They lured me with the promise of cheese and bacon and I felt duped! It was more watery than cheesy and even the bacon couldn't save the dish!

$5 margaritas were okay, but not strong at all. I had four and felt fine. I should have been buzzin' hard though; I am quite the lightweight. But they have $2 Tecates on Tuesday, which is a sweet deal, so you should definitely go for that.

The reason we went to The Boardroom, however, was to participate in Trivia Tuesday, which was disappointing, in my opinion. It started about a half hour late, which, in fairness, was due to the A's vs. Royals game going into extra innings, but it just got going too late for a work night, if you ask me. I couldn't hear the woman reading the questions. When she spoke at a good volume, she was kinda mumbling (drink much, lady?). And there were HUGE time gaps between rounds. I heard that it is usually better organized than that, but it was frustrating for me and my gal pals.

My general experience there probably warrants less than 4 stars, but I truly believe it was an off night based on what I've heard from others, the yumminess of the greasy food, and the quality of the service. Worth a shot, just beware of male patrons: they just may be nacho-stealing tards.
author: Stephenie S.

description:
Great place to catch a game (what ever sport you want to see). There are at least 5 tvs inside. Its a casual local bar that can get packed depending on the day. 

Goods good, had the tachos - tater tot nachos. they came out piping hot with lots of steak. A great price for the amount of food. 

The bloody marry was good, some spiciness to it with olives, peppers and green bean vs a celery stalk. YUM
author: Kristan B.

description: Off the beaten path with surprising food quality for a little bar that has no table service. Lots of TV's and places for you and your group to sit. I like this place for after work drinks or stopping for a quick, and as I said before satisfying, meal. They take cards but $15 min for those sans cash. Be sure to check out the tater tots for a salty crunchy delight!
author: Nick C.

description: Don't get me started. Walked in to try highly-rated tater tots, entered into the sports bar ambiance and sat for 8 to 10 minutes being completely disregarded! I'm not talking about trying to catch a waiter in a busy restaurant or sneaking in unnoticed, (we come from restaurant backgrounds and can completely understand either of those scenarios), I'm talking about sitting at a bar where the bartender makes eye contact with you and blatantly refuses to greet or assist you (we are a respectable (but not snooty) looking young couple btw) bc they were too busy fiddling with tv remote and chit chatting with group of girls at a table. We left so cannot rate the food or drinks but we were frankly pissed at such blatantly disregarded service.
author: Breanna K.

description:
To the guy below that call the place "Racist". I was there and I'm african-american. You were kicked out for taking your beer outside. No place allows that if they can't serve liquor outside. The Bartender ( Sal ) was super polite, reasonable and gave you NUMEROUS WARNINGS. You and your friends were out of line and rude. You can't break the rules and be sh*tty!!!! Sorry... you gotta Pick One! That is why you got the Deuces, bruh!

This place is amazing. Great Food and Great Staff. The perfect local sports bar!!!!! From the drinks specials to the neighborhood, it doesn't get much better than this. It's kind of place you can walk in alone and leave with new friends. Love y'all!!!
author: Roxanne D.

description:
We came in last night for trivia and had a blast.

Service is great, considering how busy they were. $5 margaritas all night.
***I accidentally gave a lousy tip, I mean I did have 5 margs (but I felt really bad about this morning). So if you're reading this i promise to give you more the next time we are there (most likely next tuesday).

The food was delish too, grilled cheese and tomato soup and I split the bacon mac n cheese (only $6 for a big dish) it was amazing. I definitely want to try their brunch sometime.

The bar is pretty small so you wanna get there early if you are doing trivia to get a spot!

We will be back next week!!
author: Jordan S.

description:
Popped in here recently and like I said last time, Sal totally rocks!!!

Great little bar...across from the North Star and away from all the general craziness.
author: Roy N.

description:
Bacon wrapped tator tots !!!
Surf movies and a great atmosphere 
I love the boardroom
author: Jason G.

description:
A true North Beach gem. A must goto bar / food spot.

Service = excellent. The bartender I've seen twice, forgot his name (has a beard) is awesome. Big fan.

Drinks = $5 for Jameson and Ginger Ale. Cheapish shot and beer specials. Beers on tap are great (love the various IPA's).

Food =
The world's best (as claimed) bacon wrapped tater tots. Pretty good. Not the thickest cut of quality bacon, but wrapped in tots with a nice mayo/ketchup mix sauce is great.! ~$9 for a small plate, bit pricey but tasty.

The burgers are big and tasty, friends shared.

I got a taco salad for $9 in a cool pho bowl and the salad and beef (you can get chicken too) were great. The taco wrap on the outside was obviously from a wrapper, but hey, can't expect a bar to fry it like a Mexican restaurant.

Big fan. I'll be back for food and drink.
author: Chuck N.

description:
A couple reasons why this place is great: 

1) I took a girl here once and she HATED it. That's now I knew it was good. So I kicked that bitch to the curb. 

2) The bartender is a cool ass dude. This is weird that I have to even say this because I feel like one of the prerequisites of being a bartender should be "don't be a dick", but we all know how that usually goes. 

3) I like mimosas. 

4) The brunch was awesome as hell. I haven't had anything bad from the brunch menu. You also got to have respect for a place where the guy cooking your food, brings it to you. So you know he wouldn't dare bring you something shitty because he has to look you in the eye. 

5) I got to piss off everyone with my musical selections on the "juke box"
author: Aaron S.

description: The bartender was a great guy, talked to us about our trip to San Francisco and gave some good recommendations on the menu.  Their Island wing sauce is quite good.  Good place to go that is just off of where it seems the tourist are all going.
author: Kyle A.

description:
Have been here a few times, as my friends used to live close to the bar. There are a few smaller TVs scattered around the bar, so it's good for watching sports (but there is limited standing room so not so good if you are in an odd corner which requires you to crank your neck to see the screen).

The owners and bartenders seem to have a good relationship with the regulars so I must admit that if you aren't one, you may feel like an outsider (and the find the staff a bit annoying/pretentious). On one occasion, I sat down at the bar, which was practically empty since it was around 5PM and the female bartender took a while to acknowledge me, and when she finally did, I asked her what was on tap, and she expected me to know... On another occasion, I was here for trivia night, and the MC can be quite rude/obnoxious, but I guess others think she's funny ?

Have tried a few of the menu options, including the nachos, wings, and tater tots, including the bacon wrapped tots. Everything is pretty standard but I must admit, their plain tater tots are the best I've ever had -- for that reason alone, I would come back!
author: Siv L.

description: Great place to escape the tourist crowds. Almost didn't want to do a review because I don't want anyone else to know about it. But the bartender and the crowd inside were so great I didn't feel right now reviewing it. Great place to be.
author: Brett A.

description:
Happened to stumble upon the Boardroom one day while we were scouting drink specials in North Beach before a friend's band played at Grant & Green. 

BEST. STUMBLE. EVER.

Walked in enticed by the tecate + jagermeister special. You can't go wrong with that combo for $6. It was a pretty quiet night, so we chatted up the bartender about the confusion of which football team the bar roots for, and their beers on tap. I must have looked hungry because the next thing I know, he plops a menu down right in front of me. 

Perused it a bit, hoping for something small to tide us over before dinner time. And saw the most enticing words I have ever seen on a bar menu "Bacon wrapped tots." Bacon wrapped tots?!?!?! I was intrigued. So we ordered them up assuming the worst, but hoping for something at least worth digesting.

A few minutes later, we were presented with a plate filled with tiny brown treasures that smelled like an angel's fart (kinda salty and fills the room.... but in a good way). The bartender knew we were about to lose our bacon-wrapped-tot-virginity, so he gave us the run down. The ranch is infused with bacon au jus (!!!!!) and mixed with a bit of the house hot sauce is the perfect little bite. 

Oh dear God. My mouth was dancing. That bite was euphoric. The tot was perfectly cooked- tender and fluffy in the center with a nice tot-ty texture. The bacon, which I completely expected to be a chewy mess that would destroy the tot, was quite the opposite. The bacon was crispy and light and perfectly salty without being toooo salty. The ranch complemented the tot so beautifully as if they were created only to accompany each other in life. And the house hot sauce..... just enough heat to wake up your tastebuds so that they can experience this tot magic exactly as the heavens imagined. 

Aside from this experience, everything else about this place is fantastic. The locals are really friendly and the bartenders are freakin hysterical. There are always sports on the two TVs and the rest of the food is pretty good too. They have a great brunch menu, if you're into that kind of thing too. I hear the bloody mary is yummy.

Thanks Boardroom, for ruining tots everywhere else.
author: Mar A.

description: Awesome little sports bar with great food. As with any sports bar on a Sunday, it can get a little loud and crowded.
author: Andy E.

description:
We were able to get a table and it was comfortable and big. I got a beer and tried a couple of a friend's fries and they were yummy! I've heard this place has better than average food.

Lots of TVs too...
author: Alexandra W.

description:
Best wings in the city, period.

In general everything that comes out of their kitchen is top notch.  

Nice tenders, and 90's hip-hop playing most the time.
author: Declan M.

description: One of my favorite dive bars to visit in San Francisco.  A great place to grab a few drinks, watch some football or basketball and have some bar food.  The drinks are very reasonably priced, and they have a very fun jukebox linked to an app that allows wannabe DJs to duke it out.  Definitely worth stopping in for happy hour or some bar grub!
author: Megan L.

description:
This bar is a great neighborhood spot.  I always have a good time - whether it is for weekly Tuesday Trivia, Thursday night football, college football Saturdays...or just to pop in for a few drinks.

The beer+shot specials are always a solid choice!

Tuesday Tacos are delicious - not greasy, more gourmet.

Only complaint - sometimes when they are hosting a college team's fan base, it feels as though the bar is over capacity and impossible to even get a drink or move (I'm used to crowded rowdy bars, so this isn't just a dumb girl complaining about being squished and sweaty)...Usually find a hideout in the back dart room when this happens so it's all good!
author: Nic S.

description: Great neighborhood spot. Good food! Writing the review because we are going out of town for New Years and I just realized that means no Hangover Burger on New Years Day. SAD. Sal is pretty great so chat him up.
author: Frankie R.

description:
Went here because someone that I share a workspace with said they have good wings and other bar food.

Luckily went on the wings special night and had several tasting items from the bar menu.  Really liked the onion rings, nachos and wings while the bacon wrapped tater tots didn't quite live up to billing.

The bartender Sal was really fantastic - nice guy mellow great serving.

This place is everything you want from a local bar hang-out (not fancy)- I've already been back with my wife and she loved it as well.
author: Tom L.

description: It was exactly what we were looking for coming from out of town. Great food, reasonable prices and friendly.
author: Chares M.

description:
Dem tots. Dem crispy, bacon-wrapped tots. 

When you see a sign that says "bacon-wrapped tater tots," you're bound to come in to see what the fuss is all about. The Boardroom certainly gets some points for having this unique item on the menu, but what really sold it for me was the neighborhood vibe. THIS is what you'd call a corner bar! 

The bartender seemed to know a lot of the regulars around there. He's even a bit of a gambling man, stating that my PBR would be on the house if I guessed the number and suit on my bottlecap. I may not have been so lucky (it was the seven of diamonds), but it just gives me all the more reason to come back and try my luck again.
author: Casey S.

description:
As charming and friendly the bartender was, as much as I tried to like this place, The Boardroom is not recommended for breakfast. 

The breakfast foods are average at best. Major complaints at my table were the dry biscuits and too many salty beans in the breakfast burritos.

However we did really like the $14 pitchers of mimosas.
author: Alvin Y.

description: We came here for a quick bite when I first flew in for vacation and immediately fell in love with the whole place.  The vibe is great the food is delicious.  The cherry on top is the owner is crazy friendly! It's not packed with tourists like some places. Will definitely come back every chance I get.
author: Van N.

description:
I was drawn to this place with the promise of bacon wrapped tater tots and brunch.  I understood this is a dive bar, so I didn't expect too much. The food is cheap bar fare. There are lots of tvs showing sports and lots of frat alumni for those that enjoy those things.

The fact their cocktails lacked essential ingredients, however, is the reason I'm giving this bar a low rating.  I ordered an irish coffee that didn't have any whipped cream on top and a pisco sour that didn't have any egg whites in it. I can excuse a poorly made cocktail in a dive bar, but an incorrectly made one is where I have to draw the line. 


BONUS TIP: For good cocktails nearby, check out Tony Nic's Cafe or 15 Romolo.
author: Lara O.

description:
Great bar, awesome bartenders, cheap chicken wings and bacon wrapped tator tots...plenty of tv's to watch sports.

Bar is full of 49er faithfuls...
author: David P.

description:
Wandered into the Boardroom by myself to catch some of the NCAA tournament. I'm from out of town so the bartender was very friendly since I was all by myself. I think his name was Lou... The place had a good atmosphere and a good group of people trying to get their Friday drink on. 

The food was delicious! At the suggestion of the bartender I ordered the BLT with avocado and sweet potato fries. Delicious!! Everything tasted fresh. I wish I lived closer so I could visit this spot regularly.
author: Meghan B.

description: This place is awesome!  Salvador was the bartender and he was incredibly friendly the food is delicious.   Take my advice,  ask the cook to "get crazy" with their Boardroom burger.   You won't be sorry.   Also,  have to heard of bacon wrapped tater tots? Because you should have.
author: daniel w.

description:
An "ASU bar" but don't have the PAC-12 network. ? nuff said.  This makes me sad.

#GoDevils #getthepac12networksoon
author: Chuck R.

description: So found this place in Yelp review and decided to try it out. Those pics of bacon tater tots were just oh so inviting and did not disappoint!  I mean come on its bacon. We ordered the hot wings as well which were swimming in Buffalo sauce.I had the Mac and cheese with carnitas and bacon which was so good! Wonderful comfort food. My bf had the nachos which were pretty good as well.  They were playing Breakfast Club which is a great movie.  Then they played MS Doubtfire. The bar patrons were friendly and gave great advice to us tourists. This was a chill Sunday night. Sal the bartender that night was really great and gave good advice and service, he was very friendly and talkative. We had a great time. Will definitely come back when in town! Great food, drinks and people!
author: Ann C.

description: Great dive bar in north beach away from crowds
author: Chris P.

description: Monday night WANGS is good and so as the bartenders and the people that sits and drink beer like I do
author: Jsphn T.

description:
I couldn't agree with Jane A. more, you MUST try their bacon wrapped tots (given that your heart can take it).

On the drive home after a night of drinking & hunting with fellow yelpers, I couldn't help but think that they were the most:

HEAVY GREASY ARTERY-CLOGGING DEATH-INVITE that I can't help but want to eat. 

And I can't help but want more. :]
author: Christine L.

description: DELICIOUS food, very reasonably priced, great portions, and the bartenders are so nonchalant about how great the menu is.
author: Shaila B.

description:
On weekend mornings when you can't stand the thought of dragging yourself into a pair of heels and curling your hair for brunch, there is The Boardroom.

A divey, welcoming establishment where the weekend brunch-time bartender takes pride in entertaining his patrons. It's like having brunch at a friend's house - aside from getting a check at the end.

The bloody mary is divine and garnished with a house-pickled green been (yum), $14 pitchers of mimosas are just what some weekends call for, and the irish coffee is so, so lovely.

The breakfast BLT is crispy and buttery and pretty much everything your poor pounding head needs. Also tasty is the breakfast burrito (with sausage) and bacon wrapped tots are a classic.

I'm not a fan of sweet food for breakfast, but the biscoff french toast looks amaze as well.
author: Caroline M.

description: We came on Taco Tuesday and got 3 Tacos each. It was a perfect size and delicious!
author: Lisa D.

description: Travelling from the east coast and watched football here start at 10am. If you don't try the tater tot tacos you will be missing out! Great place!
author: Tagns 7.

description:
Every place I visit frequently, I need to find "the spot" where I can be the not-so-regular, regular. This is my place, starting back when it was Woody Zips.

The food is always tasty although the menu has changed a bit over the years. The bar tenders really do a great job catering to both the true regulars, the not-so-regular regulars.  

Enjoy, catch a game, and "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." (Oscar Wilde)
author: Dave W.

description:
Stop #4 on the crawl... The Boardroom is pretty small and not great for big groups, but the weak had dropped out so the 10 or so of us remaining grabbed a booth in the corner and the stools lining the entry way. They have a pretty full bar and a few beers on tap. The bartender wasn't mean, although he could have been friendlier, but I guess he made my drink and it was fine so who am I to complain?
They have lots of TVs which is nice, and the crowd was pretty low key. It's slightly off the tourist path so everyone there seemed to be local. I even ran into some old friends.

Just a note that their credit card minimum is $15 so bring cash.
author: Rachel E.

description: I was surprised to realize that I have never written up the Boardroom.  It is a regular drinking stop when in North Beach although stopping depending on what games are on because getting a bar seat is hit and miss so we don't always get to stay.  What I love about the place is they carry my drink,  the bartenders, a bar seat and the nachos.  If memory serves me they make their own chips, which is key and the carnitas were our favorite.  We have tried other things like the maple bacon, who doesn't love a plate of bacon, the bacon wrapped tots (wasn't impressed enough to order again) along with a few other things but I can't comment on because they are not standing out in my mind.  Since we go often I'll make a note to self to update my review as I try new things.  Give the Boardroom a try it's a great hangout.
author: Dianne M.

description: We ended up at this busy little dive on a Sunday morning for Brunch. They were playing college football and a mix of random music genres, & the crowd was super friendly and unpretentious.  The food? Surprisingly good. I had a bellini cocktail,  he had coffee, & we were both satisfied. Awesome bacon, yummy breakfast burritto, fresh quality fruit. This isn't a place we'd drive out of the way for, but we had reasonably priced, fill-you-up food with no wait.
author: Kristeen O.

description: Friendly service. Great food (bacon wrapped tators,! Deep fried pork buns with awesome sweet and spicy sauce!). Great drinks! Non pretentious patrons that will sing along to Whitney Houston and do push ups for shoes! What more can you ask for?
author: Michelle S.

description:
Small, hole in the wall, neighborhoody, pub in the outskirts of North Beach. Good service, tasty bar bites, and bumpin' jams. 

The bacon wrapped tatter tots are crispy and unique, and the nachos are humungous topped with everything you can think of!
author: Alysha K.

description:
Maybe I am just in a giving mood today as my reviews seem to be glowing but this one really deserves it. WE were looking for a place that my friend could watch the game and we finally landed mainly due to Yelpers on this place. The fact they had bacon wrapped tater tots was simply deep fried icing on the cake. When we go there we were surprised at how small it was but they indeed had several screens on and one of them was the game my friend wanted to watch. We of course wanted to dine so the extremely cool and helpful bartender (Martin) got us fixed up with menus.

The selections were not your typical bar food, my friend had a veggie burger with sweet potato fires, I can vouch for the fries as I stole a few (for review purposes of course). I ordered the signature bacon wrapped tots, and a breakfast burrito that took up the entire plate. It was very tasty and really not too overwhelming for its shear mass, but had what I have to assume was house made guac, and other goodies. I also had their secret sweet tea vodka concoction which I have to admit would be dangerous if consumed too fast or if you had to be somewhere serious but in the context of brunch it was just right. So I had 2. 

I guess the biggest plus for this place was it was clearly a neighborhood pub, and we were clearly not from the area but I felt they treated us as if we were there every night, I think anybody can sling drinks but Martin made us feel like he was opening his home and making sure we got whatever we needed. And he had great taste in music which never hurts.

If you are looking for a great brunch and what I assume is a great place when the sun goes down to enjoys some drinks head on over to The Boardroom.
author: kevin g.

description: My alumni group scheduled a game viewing here which is probably the only reason I would have stumbled upon this place. It's not a huge bar, but I didn't feel claustrophobic when it started getting pretty packed after the game started. I scored some seats up front by the window and when it wasn't too busy, the service was great. I had an order of the crispy pork buns (good+) and the bacon wrapped tater tots (over-hyped and only okay), as well as my fair share of drinks. My main complaint is that well into the evening, there was a TON of people in the bar and only one bartender, so it took forever to get a drink after he noticed you at the huge bar. This wouldn't stop me from returning, but I hope they plan for better coverage when they have events like that.
author: Candace R.

description:
This place is so fantastic. The bartenders are the nicest around and the food is great. I originally discovered this place because they tended to be a Saints/LSU bar. Now the sports team of choice changes more frequently, but I still love coming. 

Went over the weekend and had the corndogs (delish), and hung out with the bartender. He was super friendly, and even gave us suggestions of what bar to go to next since we had a friend from out of town we were showing around. Definitely a must do if you're in the North Beach area.
author: Lauren D.

description:
This Bar just gets it. Everything is what it should be. The drinks are cheap and good. The bar tender with long hair from Canada offers great suggestions and gives relevant info to what you came for. 

The burger is hands down the best I've had in the 2 years in SF. Pssst they're ground fresh, in-house WITH BACON INSIDE!

I'm all for dive bars, but I'd still like to have a sanitary bathroom to use when nature calls and the Boardrooms is fully stocked, clean and in working order. Ah feels good to have a clean place to wash up.

Trivia nights on Tuesdays are fun, music can be controlled via your cell phone app. 

The list goes on and on about how everything is done right. Non-pretensious bar sure to provide a good time every time. 

Next time I'm in the mood for another burger I'll be at Boardroom baby :-) 

-Cheers
author: Richard L.

description: We travel over an hour just to come get their delicious bacon wrapped tater tots and burgers! Food is amazing!
author: Brianna W.

description:
A solid, local neighborhood bar with a great atmosphere. My go-to for 49ers football. The bar food is damn good too. I've had a burger, veggie burger, breakfast chroizo tacos, and the famous bacon-wrapped tots--all are really, really good. Solid bloody mary's as well, albeit a little pricey at $8.

Order a PBR and guess the playing card number/suit that's underneath the cap and they'll pay for your beer. I actually won the last time I was there.
author: Steve B.

description:
Came here while the $6 fernet + tecate or fireball + tecate deals were advertised.  Decided I had to finally try fernet, as I am a San Francisco native and it would only be appropriate to say I have drank it.  

Suffice to say that those deals have changed my drinking choices forever.  

Fernet & Fireball 4 Evr.

Also, they have a dart board in the back, and that is good fun with a small group of friends.

Chill place, friendly bartenders, friendly crowd.  A+ would drink again.
author: Jaclyn L.

description: Taco Tuesday is off the hook. Try the carnitas tacos. And you can never go wrong with bacon wrapped tots
author: Jacob W.

description:
The Boardroom is my FAVORITE bar in San Francisco. And that is saying A LOT because San Francisco has so many amazing bars! Here are a few of the many reasons why:

- $2 Tecates and $6 for a Tecate and a shot = a great, easy deal
- Amazing special cocktails (if you know what to ask for...!)
- Great food: love the breakfast tacos and sweet potato fries especially!

AND...
- This is the bar where everyone knows my name! Yes, CHEERS! :)
author: Meghan P.

description: Great place to watch football. The bloody Mary's are amazing as well. This place has bacon wrapped tater tots... Enough said.
author: Ali C.

description: Nice spot with cheap drinks, happy hour and trivia night.
author: Michelle F.

description:
North Beach Burger.... Heyyyyyylllll-YEAH!!
