Cured pancetta, fried egg on organic Black Angus? With sweet potato fries? I licked that plate clean. 

Free WIFI so I can finish this review... 

Great photography on the wall, large prints depicting extreme sports. Being a photographer I can totally appreciate the quality wide angle work on the basketball scene, the cool skateboard shadow shot and snow sports action sequences. I can't believe I left this out of my first review, since it's a big reason I kept coming back in the first place.
author: David D.

description: Cool bar, BUT there are a few douchey guys that  run rampant 'round this place. I guess that could be just about any bar in SF, so I'm not hating, just saying.. I will definitely be back but I will bring friends and ignore all weirdos lol
author: Alanna R.

description:
Attentive but relaxed bar staff who garnishes their conversation with a lavish amount of sarcasm. I approve!!!

The burger was definitely bacon infused and my friends order of buffalo chicken tenders was an exceptionally large portion.

I live in the neighborhood and will return to grab a beer and/or sample their *apparently* amazing Sunday Brunch. 

The bartender was kind enough to let me sample his Bloody Mary mix, and it wasn't half bad...next time, I'll try it "all the way".
author: Liz W.

description: This is definitely a neighborhood bar with a dive vibe, but the food is great, the staff is friendly.  The bac-o-tots are fantastic.
author: Lisa L.

description: Great bacon-wrapped tater tots and selection of sauces to go with them. I also love that this place is dog-friendly.
author: Debra A.

description:
I watched my beloved football team play, heard Alice in Chains over the sound system, and had greasy food handed to me by a complete smartass.

The Boardroom is what I hope for in a marriage.
author: Lisa E.

description: There were 10 of us and 5 orders came out after 40 minutes. They forgot about the other 5 orders completely. The food that did come out was undercooked and bland. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. I have never had a worse experience.
author: Nick F.

description:
I just started working down the street and love all the bars in north beach but there's something extra special visiting a local bar with awesome food!! -- Every Mon, killer happy hour with something like 25cents each wing and they aren't some lame hooter wings there absolutely gourmet! I like my stuff spicy but he'll make them any way you'd like!!!
LOVE the owner Keith, if anything stop by and say hi!! Everyone that works there is great!
author: Grace g.

description:
I rarely give 5 stars, but this place fuckin rocks. Last night was the first time we went there for trivia night, having heard very good things about it, and boy it did not disappoint. The tacos were solid, and for 2 dollars each you could eat to your heart's content- I prefer the steak. The trivia girl was hilarious and pretty wasted, while the bartender knew what he was doing and didn't hate on us despite wearing A's gear in a giants bar.

Another star for the multi-media (pictures and music) trivia night. ANOTHER plus was that we won a bottle of champagne for best name (mustache rides are free).

the one caveat to this was the fact that parking is always awful in north beach, and it took us about 20 minutes to find parking. Outside of that, the boardroom rules and we likely will come back next Tuesday!
author: Samir K.

description: what goes better with beer than bacon wrapped tator tots and wings.  Good bar with nice bartenders
author: Stevezee C.

description: Cool bartender and a chill vibe in this neighborhood bar. Don't pass up the bacon wrapped tater tots. Truly an appetizer born from binge drinking.
author: Sam D.

description: The Boardroom is severely under-hyped but selfishly, I like it that way. My boyfriend and I live a couple blocks away and this is a place we can roll into when we are only half-awake and maybe a little frumpy lookin'. This place is super welcoming and the opposite of pretentious (which a lot of SF establishments are haha). As long as a big game isn't on, we never have to make reservations and the best kept secret is the FOOD. The tater tots, the croque madame, the COOKIE BATTER FRENCH TOAST? It's all SO GOOD. It's heavy though so don't come here if you are telling yourself you're on a diet. Finally, I have to give a huge shout-out to Justin and Jen, who are both very accommodating and friendly bartenders. They are the best.
author: Anna J.

description:
It was our last day in San Fran, and we were all pretty bummed, we needed food in our bellies before the trip back to LA! My roomie found the Boardroom because we were craving bacon 
walked in 
totally welcomed by the Bartender (owner?) who was super awesome
The Giants were playing
the beer and food arrived and we had a great time!
will def be returning next time i'm in SF!!!
MORE BACON TATER TOTS!!!
(on a side note: the eggs were a bit watery and had no taste but its ok because the tots made up for it!)
Turned my frown upside down :)
author: Manon M.

description:
Decent kinda-sportsy bar. This is good place to go on a Sunday to catch the game with a fun crowd and there's a dartroom or some fraternity-closet-looking room in the back. 

+ 4 or 5 midsized TVs playing all the football games
+ cheap, borderline free drinks (cocktails, beers on tap, PBRs if you're feeling ironic)
+ decent selection of food

- TVs are small
- seating can be scarce, mainly because of bros on bros on bros. 
- quality of food is hit or miss (the tater tots tasted unusual)

Worth checking out if you're in the area, don't make a trip out of it though.
author: Rina M.

description:
My new company recently celebrated its launch party at The Boardroom, and we recommend it wholeheartedly.

My first experience with The Boardroom was a random Friday night for happy hour a few months ago.  The place has a cool, surfer theme, which was appropriate for watching "Point Break" on the bar's TVs. That was not Casey's choice of movie (the manager who was tending bar that night) but he was joking along with us, chatting with everyone.   He even recommended a great new gin to freshen up my tonic.

When we finally contacted him about the possibility of having our launch party there, he was nothing but accommodating.  It's hard to find a place for 30-40 people for a weekday happy hour without a crazy price tag or an attitude.  Casey was as happy to have us there as we were to find such great place.  And in all our planning, Casey was quick to call back, professional with a sense of humor.  Perfect.

The event went amazingly well.  Ben was the fantastic bartender taking care of us that night.  He was so nice, and made great drinks.  He and Casey even made a signature cocktail for us for the party.  We also were able to plug our iPod into the sound system and enjoy a personal playlist.

What really sealed it for me is that the next morning, Casey gave a quick call to see how the event went.  That was unnecessary and completely appreciated.  So if you are looking for an event space for 20 - 60 people, definitely give Casey a call.

Even the regulars at the bar are super-friendly and nice.  The food here is really good, as well - can't beat bacon-wrapped tater tots.  It's a very clean place with a warm vibe.  (And no, there is no broken sink, like in the photos - it's a perfectly nice bathroom!)   When you find yourself in North Beach, thirsty or hungry and in need of a friendly face, head to The Boardroom.
author: Karen H.

description:
I love this bar! And here is why:

- the atmosphere, because it's neighborhood friendly and everyone talks to each other. It's still in North Beach but you're less likely to get into fights with hoodrats stumbling drunk out of the clubs.
- trivia nights because the whomever has the best team name wins champagne. And also the questions aren't too hard... love it when they have the questions about movies and clips of it they show on the screen. Almost too easy for me!
- food deals up the wazzooo... cheap and delicious! 50 cent wings on Mondays, and their tacos on Tuesdays are quite delicious. 
- almost always having Mirror Pond on tap
- their decor is quite lovely. They don't call it The Boardroom for nothing.
- great place to watch games. Everyone gets into it!
- they have great bartenders. Especially Ben, whom is very witty and charming and is always up for some conversation.

Long story short, it's an all around cool bar to be at. You all should go!
author: Caroline L.

description: came here for the game last wed. they had $5 burgers which was pretty darn good. place is big enough for large groups. mixed drinks were on the expensive side and it was bland. no alcohol taste so we ordered a shot and then a back and mixed it ourselves. just the shot itself was like $10! $.50 cents wings were good! But only on mondays. I would come here more often if it wasn't for the location. It's on the other side of the city from where i live......too far and hard to find parking.
author: Alyce l.

description:
Was visiting from out of town and needed a great, friendly sports bar.  I came across the Boardroom via several reviews/posts from several site -Yelp included.  I showed up for some Thursday night NCAA football (GO Tigers!) and was pleasantly surprised with the vibe, service and food.  

Kieth  was behind the bar and made sure the drinks were refilled quickly, food arrived promptly and he is happy to weigh-in with recommendations on the menu.  All-in-all a great venue and experience.  When I am back in SF I will be sure to return.
author: Trent W.

description: Was having a pretty good time here with a group of friends until I was getting ready to leave. I was waiting on my boyfriend when suddenly I felt something hit my chest. The bartender had thrown a plastic cup at me from behind the bar. When I asked him why, he stated "You looked like you weren't having fun." Yes, because hitting me with a projectile object is going to help me have an awesome time. Screw you. Who behaves like that and works in customer service?
author: Alex S.

description: Perhaps one of the only hidden gems left in San Francisco. The food is incredible, the bacon-wrapped tots are fun, and everyone who works there is kind, gracious and cares about the food they serve. Take a shot of Fernet while you watch a local game without being jostled by tourists or Bay Area snobs looking for the coolest new place.
author: Emily S.

description: Open till 2am!!!!!  You can actually order cooked bacon as an appetizer or get the bacon wrapped tator tots.  12 for $8
author: Brian S.

description:
Went here just for the bacon wrapped tots...they were so good! The price of them..not so good. Guess we just missed the happy hour prices when we went. $8 for about 10 tots...kinda not worth it. We got 2 orders so $19 for meh maybe 20? Nope, not worth it in my opinion. 
Liked the large amount of seating though and the other food looked yummy too.
author: Cesie A.

description:
Semi dive-like bar with enough room to fit about 50 people. Yes, small!

There were a lot of late 20-somethings here in a Thursday as there wasn't much else around here. There were some tater tots floating around that look amazing, but we did not get any food.

Beer was cheap enough but we were only here for one, so that's about all I can say.
author: Susan F.

description:
It's a dive bar in a neighborhood with dive bars.

We didn't have any food, but ya know, saw a lot of people eating food that we didn't really want to try.  The service was nice and all, but we wanted to check out.

Questions to ask before you enter:
- Do you like dive bars?
- Do you want to drink for cheap?
- Do you want to have a good time?

If you answered yes to one or any of these, enter The Boardroom at your own risk.
author: Glen S.

description:
The fried food is pretty damn good.  as in the tots are really good.  The BLTA is also really good.  the dip is decent.  The sweet potato fries are pretty good too.  good spot to check out for lunch during non-sports hours, since nobody is really there.

The beer and drinks are standard here.

if you're not going for a meal, check out the bacon wrapped tater tots, also worth checking out - though every time i've had them, i was drunk.
author: Jason J.

description:
Decent sports bar. I came here for the first time last night for trivia. Bacon wrapped tater tots are good but kinda a rip off at $8 for like 10 of them....

I would come back though.
author: Gina G.

description:
Boardroom is amazing.  There are a ton of reasons to go,but let me list the top 4:

1- the food is AMAZING.  Try the beef brisket sandwich with tots- its phenomenal 
2- Martin the bar tender is awesome
3- prices really decent for North Beach
4- the make a killer Moscow Mule... You can't find a decent one in NB anywhere.

Go, get the brisket sandwich, you'll thank me later.
author: Rose H.

description:
Went to the boardroom with some friends last Sunday morning, because I heard they had a decent brunch and a bloody Mary that could "knock my socks off".  Both had exceeded my expectations. I had the loco moco with house made gravy, which put me directly in heaven, and the side of bacon smothered in maple syrup.  Can I just say, I will return for the bacon alone! if there is a heaven, I sincerely hope it is made of this bacon! Moving on...
     The service. 
This place was packed,  wall to wall, and the bartender (can't remember her name, but girl with brown hair) was on point. I didn't have to wait more than a minute for my drink,  which considering she was the only bartender,  I was impressed. The bloody Mary won me over. Now,  I usually hate bloody Maries,  but I was peer pressured into it, and I am very happy I was! I've tried others since, but meh... Not the same. 
     In conclusion, I'm now a fan of the boardroom. They said they have trivia on Tuesdays, so I'll have to come back for that! Believe that I will review that night too!
author: Kevin G.

description:
This is a really good spot on any North Beach pub crawl. I've been here a few times and it's never too crowded. The staff is generally pretty cool and pretty efficient. This is the most neighborhoody bar in the area though....which is great. It helps keep a lot of the douchers away.

Every time I go in to that place though, I can't think of anything but the great times I had there when it was "Shannon's" and Katrina was the smokin' hot blond behind the bar.
author: Patrick G.

description:
been here many times and love this place. always have drink specials and good place to watch 49er football. went for GB vs SF and this place was standing room only and it was loud and crazy. people spraying beer all over the bar , groups of people hammered as fuck at 1230pm . 

Try a shot of fireball, it will blow your mind!!!!!

The morning bruch area lookeed sketchy....not only the food but placment of the setup, like someone could get raped back there!!
author: Chris L.

description:
Any place that serves bacon wrapped tater tots gets at least 3 stars. The Boardroom is a place that everyone was raving about, so when I visited San Fran, I had to check it out. I wasn't disappointed. Along with the slamming tots, the wings they served were also freaking slamming. I wasn't a huge fan of the quesadillas, but I think it was because they were filled with black beans and other veggies that I don't like. Whatever. The other food made up for it. 

The bartender was freaking awesome and knew his stuff about beer and good music. So that's always a plus. I wanna check this place out during a football weekend, because i heard it's crazy fun to watch sports at this bar. I guess it's just another excuse for coming back to San Francisco. Good work Boardroom. Boom!
author: Aaron N.

description:
ALL AROUND AMAZING!!!!!!!! I could go on a on about how great this bar is but instead, I am just going to insist that you go to the Boardroom because you are guaranteed a good time. 

One of the main reason I go to Boardroom instead of the bar across the street is the friendliness/attentiveness of staff. 

They also have a full bar, food is great (especially breakfast burrito, nachos, chicken tenders with buffallo sauce YUM, and sweet potatoe fries), great place to watch games. 

I've never been for Trivia Night but seems to be pretty crowded. 

I recommend their sister bar, Tope as well. 

Cheers!
author: Lisa T.

description: Wine was pricier than I anticipated ($8 for a house red). But it's a cute bar with friendly staff and a relaxed atmosphere. Good for people looking for a comfortable spot to have a drink and a snack.
author: Lauren T.

description:
I've been to the Boardroom a few times now and I've enjoyed it every single time.  The food is pretty decent, reasonably priced, and you get a lot of it.  

On Sunday's they have Bottomless Mimosa's for $12 and I think they have $2 Tecate's all the time.  They also have NFL games on Sunday's during the season.  Since it's an Oregon Ducks and ASU Sun Devil's bar, they have games from those schools on too.

The bartender's are nice and the service is great, even when there are lots of people there.

For a neighborhood bar, this place is difficult to beat.
author: Dipesh G.

description:
Compared to some of the other bars on that side of Columbus, The Boardroom isn't that bad. It's clean, has a couple of TVs, and decently priced drinks. The bathroom isn't the size of a closet, but the bar itself isn't that big. It seems to cater to the locals, where everyone knew each other but us. 

No comment on the food, since I try hard to stay away from food served at a typical bar where the kitchen seems to be invisible.
author: Rachelle T.

description:
It amazes me how I keep meaning to go to places that I hear about for some sort of yelper-posted event for another, end up flaking at that time, and then end up at said place totally randomly.

The Boardroom was the second stop on the "date" (and it was getting less so by this point, although seemed more so due to the switch to porter), and I'm glad I finally checked it out.  We headed over here to watch some NCAA basketball (my choice, I'm a bossy bitch) and there were plenty of t.v.s on which to watch the games...even though it seemed the channels kept switching.  

Although we didn't order any food, we managed to score some free fries which were much needed at that point.  They seem to have an excellent liquor selection, although I stuck with beer which ended up being really cheap.  Yet another bar where a cute pup wanders around, which makes it almost 5 stars for me.  

I really must come back for trivia night, and hopefully this time I'll answer some questions correctly...the other night I didn't.  Meh, I've experienced better (the date, not the bar).
author: Pam S.

description:
I always feel silly reviewing bars and lounges, because often times it isn't the place itself that makes the experience, its the people you're with.  

But in this case, they did serve food and I was around good company so this can't go wrong.  

While waiting for our table at Tony's, our group decided to venture out for a drink.  I've been wanting to try the po boys and drink specials, so I decided to scope this place out.  it's not a huge spot, but the moment I walked in, I could already see me parking myself here every friday like my favorite local bar (if I lived around here of course).

The drink special they had was a $7 Fernet (or Jager) shot and PBR.  wow.  Just wow.  2 of those please for my friend (who has never had Fernet before) and I to get us loaded up to be unable to taste any goodness from Tony's Pizza.  

We also decided out of starvation to munch on some Bacon Wrapped Tater Tots, Onion Rings, and Fries, your typical bar fares.  Delicious.  Nothing comes outside of expectations, unless you had walked in thinking you were in a gourmet restaurant where servers tend to your needs.  No.  This place gets you that greasy bar snack goodness and nothing disappointed.  

We walked out merrily relaxed, and having satisfied a small episode of the munchies.  I'll have to return to this joint in the future for more.
author: Vincent K.

description:
Monday Nights at Boardroom
The Boardroom in North Beach (http://www.boardroomsf.com/) has a very Chicago-style weekly special on wings. This is the kind of place I miss when I'm looking for the wing specials. Solid wings and a good beer, out the door minus a $20. The wings are good flavor, a bit saucy, and well cooked. Take a friend a split an order of 20. Its plenty to get all over the place and leave your fingers stanky danky in a good way. Hit it up. Definitely worth it. Finding a good seat might be tough, but its okay when all the people there are dingers just like yourself.

http://itsawingding.blogspot.com/
author: Christopher R.

description: Decent for a neighborhood dive. They accept credit cards which is also a plus.
author: Danielle L.

description:
Loooooove Martin!
He's a great guy, super funny, and always has a great story.
We stopped in after brunch at Don Pisto's on a sunday and 
had a few rounds. Super chill place, great menu, happy hour M-F.
They show all games and if you're lucky Maya the doggie will be around. . .
author: Kia B.

description: bacon wrapped tator tots.  in theory, it sounds awesome, they were actually overcooked, dry and quite salty.  i do appreciate they give you a mix of buffalo hot sauce and ranch to dip it in, but for $8, it's a little steep considering there were about 12 tots on the plate
author: Tina A.

description:
Came here for the Supaaabowl with the boyfriend. 

1) Parking a bitch
2) There is no number 2.


Had a drink, a laugh, and got to watch the Puppy Bowl for a few minutes before the actual football game started. Let's be honest, watching dogs is much more entertaining than watching the Giants win. 

The bartender was really cool to tell my boyfriend and I that the small nachos were more than enough for the both us. Usually I'll let my stomach do the talking, but after a shot or 2 and a beer, I'll go with what he said. UGH SO GOOD. Thank you, barkeep for the suggestion. I don't think we even finished it.
author: Tiffaney L.

description:
A Sunday morning my friend and I were standing in a 2-plus hour line for a well-known restaurant with high reviews and eventually we tired of waiting and I decided to use my yelp app to look for less-crowded places near by. Luckily for us, The Boardroom was what we picked. I was a bit apprehensive of eating in a bar at 11am when I wanted some really great breakfast food, but most on yelp said it was to be trusted so we went for it. I am sooo glad I did. What first got me in there was the bacon-wrapped tater tots-they did not disappoint (except for the fact that I wanted more after we finished the basket. Don't share-get your own!). I have never had anything like them and I will be drooling at the thought of them for quite a while-at least until I get my hands on a deep fryer and perfect the recipe. After our appetizer we ordered the cookie dough stuffed French toast and the Croque madame-both were delicious. Then, as if we hadn't splurged enough, we decided to go for the pitcher of mimosa. During the time it took us to get our buzz on I played around with the really cool app that lets you pick the music in the bar from your smartphone.

The food gets an A+ and so does the service. Marvin made us feel super comfortable and welcome from the moment we walked in and gave us excellent advice on menu items, city tips and picker-uppers to help with a food coma. I also thought it was pretty cool that they served Pisco and Fernet-things I had been missing ever since my visit to Chile that have been pretty hard for me to come by in the US. Plus, they make their own alcohol infused whipped cream-delish! Every time I make my way up to Nor Cal I will definitely make sure this is one of my stops.
author: Keniki G.

description: Nice place! Very nice staff and super comfortable and chill feeling for an easy Sunday lunch. Must try their bacon tots while rooting for your team on tv. Their drink selection is nice too so take a snap at it.
author: Nikole D.

description:
Bacon. Wrapped. Tots. 

It looks like a total hole from the outside, but when you walk in, it's the exact opposite. Clean, sorta dive-y, snacks, beers, tv...I'm into it. Bacotots were a lot spendier than I thought they'd be. For a dollar more than the boat of regular tots, you got like 9 bacon wrapped tots. Don't get me wrong, those bacotots were perfectly crisp and tasty, but I'm still trying to grasp why there's such a difference in quantity. Labor intensive? Meh.
author: Karena Q.

description:
Back on the Drink hunt trail! 

A quick dash up the hill to the next bar, The boardroom. We quickly found the clue above the bar. Nice  spot too. I'm really glad we went along on this drink hunt. Great way to discover new haunts.  

A round of drinks and a couple of baskets of tatertots later, (delicious by the way), we bolted down the hill to the finish line.......
author: Andrew D.

description:
I really liked this bar, not just because we won on trivia night.  Go team, So Ronrey!  The trivia was really fun.  I always prefer playing when the questions are made up by the quizmaster, rather than the canned ones that I know some people cheat at.

The questions were asked at a good pace, and they didn't take forever to score the answers.  While we played, we had 4 or 5 pitchers of Blue Moon, the steak nachos, tater tots, sweet potato fries, tacos, grilled cheese and onion rings.  Everything was decent but the nachos, tacos and sweet potato fries were the favorites.

Our total at the end of the night was really reasonable, and the bartenders were smartasses, just like I like them.  We'll be back.
author: Seong P.

description: Came here to eat dinner...not to drink, caus I kind of love bar food. I got the grilled cheese and tomato sandwich, with some tater tots. It was pretty delicious, but on par for bar food. Also kind of expensive. I tried some of my friend's bacon wrapped tator tots and they were also pretty good, but I'm not sure it's worth the price for a small platter. I know that most people here come to drink and watch sports on TV, not to eat, so I don't think it's too fair to judge them by the speediness of their food preparation (which was on the slower side) - BUT, they were really accommodating about letting us change the channels on the TVs to watch what (sports game) we wanted to, which I thought was cool.
author: Melody L.

description: Love love LOVE this place! Best bloody Mary's and breakfast! Great place to watch a game, super nice people
author: Tiziana Z.

description: Great food and drinks!! Bar tender is fun and very generous!  You might even get a firebomb on the house if you're cool!  Best place to watch the Redskins game! Order their Moscow Mule and their Loco Moco.  Yummm!!!
author: Jeanie H.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by the Boardroom:  good drinks, nice bartenders, cozy place with a decent amount of space (and seats). I got introduced to the Boardroom when I went on a pub crawl that stopped there.

From the name, i thought it was going to be a stuffy place (as in the business version of a board room), but when i got there i found that it was named was pleasantly surprised to learn that it's the surfboard kind of boardroom.

I've only ever been for drinks, but it's a chill, laid-back place to have drinks with friends.
author: Wendy L.

description: Was in the mood last Saturday for a really good Bloody Mary...  Found The Boardroom via yelp and yelp did not disappoint us!  Great Bloody Mary...the bartender put this homemade seasoning mix on the rim that was to die for and some tasty edible garnishments!  Enjoyed it so much that we asked him what was in the seasoning; he was very friendly and even wrote it down for us.  Relaxing laid-back unpretentious local place with great Bloody Marys...we will go back !
author: D B.

description:
Any bar that can hang with college and sunday football is worth 5 stars to me!

This bar is awesome.  I've now been there at least a 1/2 dozen times and I am constantly more and more impressed.  The bar staff can keep up with any crowd and is always with a positive attitude. 

I will always applaud a bar that sells PBRs in bottles and plays the game.  I recommend going and and spend all your money because they are worth it!
author: Sarah W.

description:
5 stars for some of them bacon wrapped tater tots also known as the BAC-O-TOTS of course also for our bartender

driving in the north beach area with some friends, on the window we happened to see Bacon wrapped tater tots, of course we found parking and had to venture in hahaha.

the spot itself is not that big, they do have alot to offer on tap, hard liquor and their choices for food are on point, there are several happy hour specials so you won't break your wallet coming here.

sampled one of there pilsners off tap, it was lil in-between the hoppiness and bitterness were muted since it was ice cold, refreshing and perfect for the palate of some of there bar food. hahaha

we sampled their Bac-o-tot simply genius haha tater tot i believe fried with a slice of bacon wrapped around it. enough for 3 folks to have if another choice of appetizer is offered in our case buffalo wings. The buffalo wings were standard glazed with some tabasco not to much just rite amount with ranch on the side with few celery sticks and carrot sticks

about 4 tv's that I could see 3 playing the WS Championship Giants playing and one playing motorcross, definitely a place you should venture into when in the area

food ***** for the BAC-O-TOTS hell yes
price $ happy hour M-F
service *****
ambiance ***** small, lil divey, friendly staff, bartender is a trip haha!! 

also music in the background was mellow, sounds of Benny and the Jets playing, Lowrider and other nostalgic music.
author: Clarence A.

description:
Best bar food I've had in a long time, and especially in NB. Justin get's it done, and it's always delish...

And the bartenders are great, too, especially Casey, Sal and Ben. It's a real "neighborhood-y" bar, they get to know you and treat you like regulars all the time. Makes you wanna come back just to say hello, but then you end up staying all night! :)

Keith, the owner, is a great guy and also takes the time to get to know his customers.

Easily, my favorite bar in NB.
author: Maggie W.

description: Trivia nights are fabulous and the staff is awesome. Fun chill nights are spent here. We live close and make it here at one or two times a week and it's always pleasant.
author: Lissa Z.

description: Great sports bar. This place is no frills and a fantastic place to check out and watch a game.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Great place to have some drinks while the wife is out shopping. Came here with a buddy had a good time drinking while we watched the Raiders lose another game :(
author: P E.

description: The bacon wrapped tots are the shiz but the BELT was dry and flavorless, lacking avocado and any perpetual longing for a future visit. The onion rings were decent and the one dude I met was friendly but Overall  this bar is good for the tots but lacks much else
author: Andrew J.

description: Boardroom is the perfect, sticky, delicious-bar-food-fried, fast beer and shots football bar I've been to in SF. It's a serious Arizona State University football bar too! A-S-UUUUUUUUUU!!!!
author: Emily R.

description: Was in here on a chill Wednesday night. Scanning the beers, I was unsure what to order. I noticed one tap I didn't recognize and the bartender noted it was a Firestone Pale Ale that he highly recommended. I figured I'd see if he was worth his word and was pleased that he was. They'll give it to you straight here and give you something good.
author: Stephen S.

description:
Sweet Jesus what a night. My buddy and I had just got into San Francisco, it was Halloween Saturday and we'd finished off a 12-pack in our hostel whilst trying half-heartedly to decide what to do. We'd just come off five nights in Vegas so we were a little worse for wear, and weren't sure if we had it in us to go out. I consulted Yelp anyway, memorised the directions to the Boardroom and away we went.

Since we're idiot Australians, we didn't have costumes for Saturday night as we were going to buy them the next day for a party we were going to. So we were essentially the only two people in the place not dressed up. But it didn't matter; bartenders Bruce (Magnum PI) and Ben (Zach Galifianakis) gave us some sage advice on Halloween culture and then plied us with booze. All fucking night.

At some point, one of the guys decided the bar needed to hear the soundtrack from The Hangover, which I just so happened to have on my iPhone. Minutes later, my iPhone was responsible for music for the next hour and a half, even after the soundtrack ran its course. There I found myself, rapping in the back of the bar with a random local girl and thinking "wow, they're playing some kick-ass songs in here!" Duh. 

I'd also like to use this review to apologise to the off-duty bartender who I kept buying Jameson shots and PBR for, even though he was wasted. I'm sorry man. I know you didn't need them, God knows I didn't either, and one of us had to drink them.
author: Adrian C.

description: Didn't expect it, but all the food here was really good. I had one of the best burgers, and some good fries! For SF the price is also very reasonable.
author: Jeroen R.

description: I am revising this poor review (1) to a (3) reflecting management care and reaching out to me to correct the problem. I would've given a (4) if it weren't for an employee's extreme rudeness at the location. White male with long blond hair and tattoos. He was very disrespectful to our group the first time we ever went. After discussing with other employees this seems to be a common occurrence for this dude.
author: Kevin H.

description: holy crap, the bacon wrapped tots were simply amazing!  worth it to come here just for them!
author: Wayne C.

description:
I am really happy that The Boardroom is just around the corner from my apartment.  I am not so happy that I've only been there once, but my first experience was awesome!

After a quick dinner at Mo's, Luis and I met up with some cool yelpers at The Boardroom last Tuesday for $2 beer special/tacos and Trivia Night.  I agree with Mr. Luis, we should have just had dinner at The Boardroom, too -- the menu looked good and how could I have turned down tater tots and fish tacos?!?!  Will definitely try food next time...

We arrived a little before eight, bar wasn't as crowded as we expected.  A few Yelpers already stationed along side the bar.  Drinks were ordered.  $6 for a can of Olympia beer and a shot of Jager... tempting, but no thank you.  I had Mirror Pond Ale all night long.  More people arrive, our Yelp team got bigger so we had to split in two different teams before trivia started.  

Trivia.  7 Categories.  Current Events.  Naming the Person's name by looking at a printed picture. Pop Culture. Music clips. Commonalities (things words have in common). Movie clips. Random category.  70 Questions total.  Rule number 1 is do not yell out the answer.  Rule number 2 is no cheating (aka: using iPhones to get answers).  Rule number 3 is DO NOT YELL OUT the answer.  Simple enough.  The host is great, she had to remind a few people about the rules and had a bit of trouble with the microphone.  

Trivia lasted for a while, maybe about an hour and a half.  In the end, my team lost by a couple of points.  But hey, we still won a $25 bar tab for the best team name... "A Colin in the Barack is worth two in the Bush."  Can't complain.

Good food and drink specials, great service, nice casual bar and an interesting crowd.  I'm so disappointed that I'm not here more often.  One of my 2009 New Year Resolution will be to go to The Boardroom more often -- that'll be an easy resolution that I can keep all year, I think.
author: Celeste M.

description:
Simple happy hour menu. $6 for a can of Tecate and a shot of Jager...order a few and you'll be feeling very happy. Add some tater tots for $3 and you're good to go. Well drinks are $4. They have about 5-6 beers on draft. 

I don't recommend the original po' boy. It's a sandwich with fries, small bits of pulled pork and gravy all smothered in the middle. I imagined it to be meatier. But it basically turned out to be gravy and fries between two slices of bread. 

The bartender was very friendly. He continued to give us happy hour prices even though it was past 7pm. You won't get your tourist crowd here for sure. It's definitely a locals joint.
author: Jun W.

description: Good Selection of beers, good bar food and cool bartenders. Good place to catch a game.
author: Paul A.

description: Pretty simple.....great food, prices, vibe, bartender......and the only place to watch a 49er game!!!!! Home of the bacon wrapped tators :-)
author: Mark B.

description:
I went here for Trivia Night and I wasn't that impressed. It might be because I love my old trivia joint and this just didn't cut it or it could be because the girl who runs it sucks at it. She needs an assistant or someone to help her host the thing. It takes too long for her to tally the questions and she comes up with the questions on her own so they are pretty narrow in range. It was also extremely crowded and not well suited for trivia. They had one round that was visual on the TV and the people in the back had to make their way to the other side of the bar to see it. It just wasn't as fun and carefree as the one I'm used to. Get there WAY early if you want to get enough space for a team of more than just you.

The bar itself is cool. A bit divey but has great personality and could be a cool hang out when it's not slammed with people. I'd probably go back to just socialize and drink on any other night...
author: Whitney C.

description:
My wife and I were in town during college football season and were looking for a place that both served food and had our
Oregon Ducks on.  We searched around Yelp and found this place by chance. It doesnt look like much from the outside, but glad we decided to go in. 

The owner is an Oregon alumn and showed up just after kickoff. He was really friendly and sat down with us and rooted the team on. 

The lunch was very good, good size portions and good quality ingredients. The tots were amazing. The breakfast food looked equally as good when it was coming out just before kickoff. 

The Boardroom gets 5 stars for the friendly people (fans and employees alike) and being a good value for such a small hole in the wall bar.
author: Jeff W.

description:
I'll make it brief:

Good jukebox, fun neighborhood peeps, and super friendly bartenders. Good bar food, too! I still need to try their brunch...
author: sarah a.

description: Great local bar.  The tots wrapped in bacon are overrated.  The mac and cheese is awesome.  I need ot try the burger next time.  I'll b back
author: Fatty A.

description: This place is basically a one stop shop for hangover treatment. Delicious, greasy food. Cheap drinks. Good bartenders. Great jukebox. The type of place that makes it easy to turn breakfast into an all-day bar hangout.
author: Cam M.

description:
The hopes of a breakfast at Mama's were squashed when it was after 11:00 AM so obviously the line was even more absurd than expected, so we yelped this spot.  My boyfriend thought I was crazy as we were wandering through North beach and show up at a seemingly divey bar.  I pleaded my case, "they get great reviews!!!" :D so we walked in and were greeted by the bartender who gave us great suggestions for breakfast and made fresh pureed fruit bellinis. (melon, kiwi, champagne = perfection)  I ordered the breakfast sandwich with tots of course and boyfriend got the eggs, sausage and tots.The meals took some time to prepare, which during that time we got to taste their home made bloody mary mix, irish cream and pickled green beans ~ the bartender (I am blanking on your name!) was so friendly and everyone in the bar was having a great time.  Followed up our breakfasts with some Strongbow and was a perfect start to our day. 
P.S. Found out this is one of the few 49ers bars in the city so it's packed on game days!
author: Rebecca S.

description: Meh chicken wings, meh bacon wrapped tator tots.  Food was average.
author: C L.

description:
Taco Tequila Trivia Tuesday

When I heard of this aptly titled trivia night at The Boardroom, I knew I would have to check it out for the aliteration alone.

I arrived at 7:30 on Tuesday night with three co-workers for trivia and bonding time with new employees. Upon entering, our new art director ordered a round of Jager bombs, a variety of salty deep fried foods a round of beers to follow. Yeah, it was that kind of Tuesday night.

We got a great table in the corner an the crowd slowly but surely began to gather as it neared 8:30. We had our exceptional Jager bombs and though they don't have a large selection of beers on tap, they a great selection behind the bar. Our food soon arrived and we devoured deliciously flavorful shrimp tacos, corn dogs with a fabulous cornmeal batter and something as sinister, and fabulous as bacon wrapped tater tots. We were all fat kids last night.

The night progressed with more jager and tequila shots to go around. We didn't win trivia night and came to the conclusion that we need a geography wiz and someone well versed in bad movies. 

As a whole, the bathroom is pretty clean, the bartenders are friendly and the space is small but cozy. It's just the right size crowd for this type of event and it turned out to be a fantastic evening out. I will surely go again once we brush up on our bad movies.
author: Stephanie H.

description: Great bar type food and bartenders in a locals spot. Everything on the weekend brunch menu is good (in general, not just for a bar) and don't forget the Bloody Mary and bac-o-tots for dessert! My favorite trivia spot, sports bar and hangout bar.
author: Natalie W.

description: This is one of the best bars in SF for good, blue collar, eating and drinking. The bartender (Dom I think?) is a great dude and pours you a beer quickly. They have several TVs and they even put on the Sacramento Kings for me (which no one else cared about). If you haven't been, swing by on a Monday for 50 cent wings. They have about 20 flavors and the guy cooking them takes real pride in his wings. Bars like this are becoming rare in SF so support them when you can.
author: Curtis L.

description:
A place that serves pulled pork sandwiches and bacon wrapped tater tots is as good as it gets! I cannot stop talking about the tots. So amazing! 

The service was also great. It's a good locals spot or place to stop by if in the neighborhood.
author: Katie M.

description: Went for drinks and late night. Awesome late night menu until 1. Corn dogs are delicious. Bacon tots may sound good, no bueno. Great bartender/awesome service. And best of all, amazing music. Lots of hits!
author: Ryan M.

description:
Hit this place up after the Super Bowl and it was thankfully quiet for at least a half an hour or so.  I enjoyed two Seagrams Sweet Tea Vodka on the rocks, watched one of my friends continue to get playfully intoxicated, and took a few choice looks at a super cute bartender.  

Then...

About 15-20 bubbly 21-23 year olds busted into the joint, flashing their debit cards to buy a round of the $3.00 16oz Coors Lights for their parties of four and we, of the enlightened elite, simply had to bounce shortly thereafter.

Ah, to be young again...
author: Tamar D.

description:
Well, I live across the street from this place and I constantly use their TV's as my personal cable.  The bartenders, Casey and Martin, are great guys and their service is always on point.  The owner Keith, has done a great job at making a great bar.
There are so many great things to say about this place, let me try:
-They make their own Bloody Mary mix
-The food is really damn good
-Their drink specials are great
-Taco Tuesdays
-$2 Tecate
-$3 PBR

I suggest this as a spot to grab a bite and watch sports, or have a pub crawl and get shithoused.  

Go, enjoy yo' self, be merry!!!
author: Jason E.

description:
5 Stars alone for being an ASU bar.  GO DEVILS!

Great burgers and solid Sunday brunch as well.
author: Marc H.

description: ASU bar!! GO devils. Its pretty small but a good local joint.
author: Jess O.

description: Delicious food, fabulous mimosas, amazing Bloody Caesars, and a hysterical bartender.   Thanks Martin for helping us on our Sunday Funday brunch
author: Samantha P.

description: I love this place. Bartenders are great, drinks are cheap and strong, tots are delicious. This place will treat you like a regular even if it's your first time there.  I feel like I have been looking for a bar like this for years... so glad I finally found it!
author: Alison B.

description:
Cool bar.  The bartender is great here.  They also sell food here.  Check their chalk board for specials that they have during the week.  This bar is really close to me but I prefer the bar across the way only because I go to a bar for drinking and entertainment, not for the food.  

Don't get me wrong, this bar is cool, but I do like free billiards and more TVs to watch certain games.

Thas all....
author: Limzer L.

description: Love love love this place! Trivia is fun but get there early for a seat! Drinks are great and well priced. Don't expect fancy drinks + martini's, this is my favorite local dive!
author: Amber M.

description: I don't live in San Francisco but every time I go this place is a must. Walking here for a good drink after having dinner, or even ordering food there (really good) while watching every game that's on and having nice chats with a bartender is what you can expect.
author: Roxanne R.

description: The board room has that mystery ingredient which makes a normal bar awesome. Pretty sure its not the $2 Tecates, nor is it the new jukebox, it could be the food specials of which i tried the thursday pulled pork sandwich ($7), which comes with delicious sweet potato fries and sour cream but i dont think its it.  The awesomeness of this place comes from the folks running this place - when the bartender pulled out a sample of Imperial I switched my order, to Imperial, he informed me that it was a sample, so I got the Tecate. Later after attempting to get some vegan food at the loving hut and finding it closed we returned, got a sandwich and the bartender offered his lone imperial - which was just one demonstration of the awesome service we got at the board room, (definitely gets the venue stars).
author: Oleg H.

description:
For all you Arizona State alumni that live in San Francisco The Boardroom offers up a really nice little bar for all the ASU football games.

Service: Excellent with one bartender and basic w/ another so that averages out to above average...like a B.  

Booze: decent to shelf liquors at decent prices...small selection of drafts with nothing to write home about.

Grub: Don't know.  It's in North Beach which basically has about 14 restaurants per square foot (no exaggeration)...so I usually eat elsewhere.  However, I have witnessed their Tater Tots covered with melted cheese.  How can you fuck this up?  Therefore, the food must be about average if you feel like eating there and regretting later what you eat (read basically just like any average bar food).

Nuts and Bolts: They actually have really....really clean floors.  Recently, an earring may have been lost on the ground and our party searched the floor for it's whereabouts (to no avail) but I did remark to myself "Wow, these floors are like...pristine...even for a non-bar they'd be impressive."  The bathroom is spacious and as clean as you can expect.  The bar area is large and there is an abundant amount of stools to accommodate most of the patrons. 

Intangibles: This is an ASU bar.  On a Saturday you can find that 90% of the TVs are tuned into the ASU game or games that will effect ASU.  So c'mon down if you're an alum!  If not, c'mon on down anyway because it is a decent bar!

Well don't come if you're from University of Arizona...

...well that may be moot since chances are if you're an alum from U of A you probably are delivering pizzas on any given night so you're probably busy.
author: Chris D.

description: Great place! What up Sal and jen!
author: Reynard H.

description:
I mean, when you're looking for a good bar, you want:

1) Cheap drinks? Check
2) Small crowd? Check
3) Anything that's wrapped in bacon? CHECK!!
4) Cool bartenders? Double check.

Great place to blackout on Sundays during COLTS GAMES!!  Go Horse!
author: Ben N.

description:
Decided to give this place a try after our visit to Northstar across the street.  It was still early on Friday around 4-5pm and it seems they are still cleaning and getting ready.  

It's a bit dark with a lot of surfing items as decor.  The owner was behind the bar and he was surprised I spotted him as the owner.  Anyway, we decided to try the wings ($5 Happy Hour price).  It took quite a while but it was pretty tasty - there were 5 wings to the order.

Seem like people really like this place for their Tuesday trivia night and $2 taco, not really as their neighborhood water hole.
author: Gloria H.

description: Cool bar, not exactly a dive but not too trendy either. Decent selection of beer and a pretty good vibe. Came here on a Saturday night and it wasn't too crowded, plenty of stool space. If you're doing a North Beach crawl, well worthy of a stopping point.
author: Justin M.

description:
My friend and I hit up the Boardroom on our Taco Tuesday Tour a couple weeks ago.

Very friendly service.  The bar was nice and clean for this type of venue, kind of "sports bar meets dive" bar.  Good spot overall.  Definitely has that "everybody knows your name" vibe going for it.

We also hit up Mojito (http://www.yelp.com/biz/mojito-san-francisco#hrid:dvymTm6MwwMq3Ph02rp7oQ).  Happy hour and food prices were better at Mojito, by far, but the tacos tasted better at the Boardroom.  Their tacos rival Nick's any day, but their shrimp tacos can't be beat.
author: Yvette O.

description:
The night I helped my buddy move in to North Beach, we decided to head out for a cold one or two (or twelve), and we started checking out the local options. I wasn't too impressed with most of the places, the sort of overcrowded overpriced bars that seem to be everywhere these days. Thankfully we found The Boardroom that night and it's become one of my favorites ever since.

It's the sort of place that makes you feel like a regular even on your first time in. You don't need to fight through the crowds of reprobates to get up to the bar, and the prices are right where they should be. People aren't there misbehaving and acting like it's the first time they've been to a bar, even if they are more than a little lit up.

We were on a liquid diet that night, but have been back dozens of times since, and the food is darn tasty. I'm convinced that the bacon wrapped tater tots may have saved my life on Superbowl Sunday. A good find.
author: Mark K.

description: We came here on a whim.  The bartender Sal made our night! I can't express how personable,  fun, and exciting he is.  His bartending skills are beyond wonderful. He introduced us to new drinks and cared when something didn't fit our taste.  We didn't originally want to stay at the bar long but made it to closing because of Sal. Thanks Sal!
author: Abi C.

description:
I was across the street at North Star and my friends wanted to get food at this place. They ordered the tator tots and I eneded up eating last one of them. They have bacon wrapped tots that are good. Of course I met Keith and Casey, what a duo. They are super friendly, way friendlier than North Star bartenders. Service was slow though, Casey was talking with some people at the other end of the bar forever and Mama needs a drink. :)

Good times, trivia night was last night, but I met up with other friends as Kozy Kar so I missed it. It was pretty packed.
author: Tina C.

description: Cool little bar with a lot of locals,  din't try the food so can't say but went on Trivia night and it was full and it seem fun.
author: Manny R.

description: So what's not to like about this place.  It's becoming a favorite spot.  Jenn is great, she makes you laugh, and great drinks!
author: Kenneth G.

description: Great neighborhood bar! Love the crowd that has been coming here for years. Good snacks too!
author: Jamie C.

description:
So I went here with my room mates for a burger and a beer and was really disappointed.  The burger was small and poorly prepared.  My fries were amazingly both burnt and cold.  For $10 I expect more than I got, even in North Beach.  Even though the place was not busy it still took an excessive amount of time to get our food.  The one upside is the bar tenders were cool.  

2 stars - food
1 star - price
3 stars - service
3 stars - atmosphere

Bottom line, if you want to wait a long time for an overpriced poorly made burger, this is the spot.  Otherwise go elsewhere.
author: Derek n.

description:
This place is for turds. I'm sorry - it had to be said. 

The Boardroom is dirty and not in a rustic dive bar way. More like a "I just walked into someone's living room and they haven't picked up their shit off the floor in months" way. It is also like a living room in that all the bros (and woman bros) at this bar seem to know each other and they all have to grunt loudly at each other and yell across the room before taking a sip of their drink.

Drinks are normal and not cheap. The food was practically inedible. Being here made me want to die. I'm not an asshole, I promise.

One star for being close to my house?
author: Emily F.

description:
Sorry to smack this place down... specially since I'm a local but I just don't seem to have a good time.  

Really small place, and a little too much trouble from the doorman (when I was there anyway)  for what it is.  The guy seriuosly accused my REAL id of being fake.  He threatened to call the cops, and I egged him on.  I guess my confidence came through cause he let me in.

I won't go as far as giving it 1 star, because I can't say antyhgin HORRIBLE happened here.  Come on a tuesday night and if trivia is your thing you'll have fun...

i'm a local and I NEVER want to go here.  When I do, i leave within 5 minutes... what else can I say?
author: Joseph F.

description:
I'm not going to lie, one of my favorite things about this place is that many times there is an adorable dog wandering around wanting to be pet.
The bar itself is great too, the bartenders are friendly and they will always put on whatever sports game you want to watch-- this seems to be kind of our go-to place for Sharks games. The bartenders will engage with you, cheer and talk about the game, which is nice.
Its also one of the few places in North Beach that has legitimately tasty bar food. Their chicken tenders are drenched in sauce, their hummus is super flavorful and their cheesy tater tots (that's right I said CHEESY) are freaking delicious! 
But seriously, the dogs are SO cute.
author: Kenzie P.

description:
My new favorite bar in North Beach.  I used to come in wayyy back in the day when it was Shannon's to watch 'gator football.  Think I might have tried it's "Woody Zips" incarnation once, but just never became a fan...it was just so clean compared to the utter sh*hole that Shannon's had been that I couldn't adapt. Plus they moved the bar from the lefthand wall to the righthand side which tripped me out.

But then I stumbled in a few Fridays back (okay I walked in...but there might have been a slight stumble upon departure), and it was packed, and I mean packed with...wait for it...,no, not hot women...I know what you guys were thinking...but dogs. Gorgeous, playful puppies.  

I'm so jealous because they are all just lying there on the couch and I *know* I can't bring my baby here because even at almost four and literally the best trained dog I've encountered in SF he's a little energetic.  Just a little bit.  Seriously, remember back when drugs were cool and people had money and did blow?  Sonny's like that ALL THE TIME.  (That's a lie, he's a Labrador so he sleeps 18 hours a day, but the 6 that he's up he's MOVING).

So this Saturday rolls around and its a beautiful day and I feel a need to get outside.  Sonny and I stroll over to meet a lady friend of mine at Washington Square Park.  We're there like 10 minutes or so when she says "You know there's NCAA basketball on right now?"  My heart melted a little.  Seriously...that's like hearing a woman say "My hot bisexual roommate wanted to know if she could join us?"

So knowing that the Boardroom is dog friendly and has at least 5 flatscreens, I decide to see if Sonny can play nice with mellow dogs.  We walk in and there's another lab, Maya, (whom I'd met before) there and the two of them get along famously, even though she's one hot bitch and Sonny still has his balls. 

It was a minor pain in the ass because Sonny's favorite room in the bar is naturally the kitchen, so I have to keep one eye on him, which leaves the remaining eye split between the game, the girl who wanted to go watch the game, and our order of tater tots.

That's right...tater tots.  The 5th food group.  With two dipping sauces, one of which was cheese.  For like $2.  Also, while I didn't partake I did notice that on weekends they offer bottomless mimosas with their brunch menu.  $12...not a bad deal.

To recap:

1. sitting in a bar with my dog
2. getting buzzed on a Saturday afternoon
3. watching Elite Eight basketball
4. with a hot girl who's idea it was to watch the basketball 
5. eating tater tots

Whoever called Disneyland the happiest place on earth never tried the Boardroom with that quint-fecta goin' on.
author: Jay W.

description:
Kitty corner from North Star, this place gets a lot of the spill over from the hopping corner bar. I, however, think The Boardroom is much better.

I consider this my go-to neighborhood bar. Keith (the owner) is awesome, and he really takes care of the locals. I like going here for Oregon Duck games if I don't want to fight the R-Bar crowd. I had my last birthday party here, and I would probably have every next one here. Keith let me do drink specials, which were named after me.

If you email Keith, he's very responsive. He loves to have special events, so he's great about working with different folks on what they want.

They also have:

--Bloody Mary bar and bottomless mimosas on the weekend
--Delicious tacos
--A hummus plate, for a nice healthy option
author: Sharon H.

description:
Went there last night for Taco Tequila Tuesday Trivia.  Loved the trivia, best MC I've experienced in SF.  My friend had a chicken taco and loved it.  I had the veggie burger and tator tots with BBQ sauce, exactly what I wanted, total soul food for me.  

Had to skip the tequila, but when I asked for heavy on the vodka wells drinks, I got them, not as strong as Bellingham, WA wells drinks, but hey they were selling $2 Oly. Seriously, I haven't seen Olympia anywhere since I left WA.  Oly is kind of as bad as Rainier (Rain-ier beer comes from here . . . - you're definetely from the Seattle area if you have any idea what I'm talking about.). 

The manager/owner (?) was great (minus eating big nasty steak with his hands in front of me, but props for noticing I thought it was gross and moving on) and his (?) dog was adorable.  Other bartender was nice too, but didn't make as strong a drink, he clearly needs to visit Bellingham or Olympia.
author: Cara J.

description: I was so glad my friend Kassidy suggested this spot for a group night out because trivia night was hella fun. The bar is kind of small but it had a friendly and cozy vibe. It looked cleaner than most of the bars in North Beach.  I liked how some of the trivia questions had accompanying images that showed up on the tv screen. With those type of questions, you foil the cheating bastards who try to look up answers on Google through their dumbphones (unless they got Google Goggles to work...).  Plus sometimes, when you're quite buzzed, you need a visual to comprehend what the hell they are asking.  I also like how they had beer specials.  Thanks to genetics, I inherited  from my dad a liver that enables me to guzzle a sh!t ton of alcohol. It gets quite expensive on my pocket and on my bf's pocket. Another plus?  They carry my favorite beer: Blue Moon!  I definitely want to go back and try their cardiac arrest inducing treats!
author: Shirleyanne A.

description: Yelp 100 and bacon tater tots...had slighly higher expectations of this small, non-descript bar. Definitely divey, and a neighborhood bar for sure. Prices are ok, food selection is limited, not sure on cleanliness...when the guy from the kitchen brought out our nachos, his towel was definitely sitting in it. Small nachos for $7 is definitely a small plate of nachos...prices not great, but not terrible. Bartender was playing music off of his ipod/iphone in-between football games and friendly enough. Nothing great, but not a bad place if you just to have a beer with friends and watch a game.
author: Michael K.

description:
Hands down. 
Keith, the owner, has tailored made a bar that blends a bit of North Beach, a non-cliche sports spot and a local feel that makes you feel at home right away. Every time I have taken friends here, we walk away with that special feeling that only a Tiger beer and Russett & Sweet Potato fries can provide. Be there for Taco Tequila Tuesday Trivia and embrace a hound of locals playing plus enjoying great drink specials. Since it is a smaller spot, I recommend taking a large group with you so and your friends can be the party... as it should be every time you go out.
author: Mario G.

description: $6 for Tecate and a shot of fernet isn't a bad deal, but the bacon-wrapped tots is somewhat pricey for what (little) you get.  You'd be much better off ordering the chicken tenders - they'd be more filling at least, for about the same price.  They are very salty though, so be prepared to order more beer to wash it down with.  It's a vicious cycle!  The bartenders are great though.  I second what Alison B. said that they treat you like a regular even when it's your first time there (or your second time within the same day).
author: Jenn C.

description: Yummy beers on tap! And tater tots!!! The bartenders are ALWAYS really nice, I love it here. It's also stumbling distance from Rogue. Yay! If you want to drink somewhere in North Beach and feel like a local I say come here. They also have brunch now? Great! Play that silly dice game and enjoy a fairly priced alcoholic beverage. It's super clean, unpretentious, relaxing. Conclusion: perfect for weekdays, great hole in the wall.
author: Amy W.

description:
My dear friend "Pants Free" Patton wrote me a little ditty a while back- allow me to share:

(sung to that really annoying Sound of Music tune, only awesomer)

Raindrops on roses and beerpong with blokes,
Boys who ride motorbikes, and like to Superpoke
Gchats, and Yelping, and kickball outings
These are a few of Anna's favorite things!

Patton was totally bang-on, but she did neglect to mention one of my most revered activities: trivia! Turns out there's a lot of useless knowledge in this head of mine, amidst all the air.

A group of my girls and I went to the Boardroom to try our luck at the pub quiz, and indulge in two dollar tacos. Since I'm fiscally irresponsible, I eschewed the deal and went for the significantly pricier calamari and quesadilla, and consequently had to undo my top button of my pants when I was done stuffing my face. Thanks for covering that up, sweater!

My friends and I turned out a solid performance, and even though we didn't win the whole thing, we were victorious in the challenge for best team name- no one came close to "That Prickmadam's Titular Area Is A Real Cockchafer, But I'd Pay $50 To Do A Dickey Grind In Her Cooter." (The Prickmadams, for short.) Yup, the classiest broads in the place got a free bottle of dumpy champagne, which we subsequently chugged...out of the bottle.

Minus 1 star since I went to preschool with one of the bartenders there, and he pushed me down the stairs when we were two. Additional star will be added when he buys me a shot to make up for it. :)
author: Anna K.

description:
I have yet to be thrown out of this bar, or kicked in the nuts whenever I show up.  That is saying a lot considering the abuse that is sure to follow me here and be unleashed on the bartenders.  I don't even know how to describe it.  You would have to see and experience it for yourself.  Rather than hate me and my friends, I actually think that maybe they like us.  That or they are poisoning our drinks and need us to come back to administer each new dose.

Really though, they have great happy hour specials.  They have combined taco tuesday and trivia tuesday.  They have a really good bar menu, with tots.  The clientele are for the most part cool, which can be hard to maintain when you are so close to North Beach.  They have cool surf photos on the wall and frequently play cool surf videos on the flat screen TVs.

Conn deserves the medal of honor.
author: Luis M.

description:
Nothing boring about the Boardroom on a Tuesday Night! 

Almost a 2.5 week long binge on partying and socializing has left me running on empty (both via the bank account and my energy levels) but I wanted to check out this North Beach spot due to all the hype. 

I'm so glad I managed to get here. There are so many reasons to trek all the way up from the TL. 

1. Its off of Broadway so I'm fairly confident that it won't get packed on a Friday or Sat. 
2. Accepts credit cards ($20 min.) 
3. Real cool/fast/attentive bartenders who are easy going and know the regulars well. 
4. Totally reminds me of my regular watering hole (Whiskey Thieves). 
5. Happy Hour: $2 tacos, $2 beers, $3 Chicken Sliders, $6 Jager/Olompia special. They also have tater tots and fries. Overall, a great bar food selection. 
6. THE BEST TRIVIA NIGHT I HAVE BEEN TO. I have been to trivia night at 3 previous bars and this trivia had the most diverse set of questions which allows everyone to participate. Now if they only had a round of flip cup, that would be just peachy. We won second place for the best team name. Woot. 

Can't wait to come back for those tots. 

ps. To the cute girl I met that night: See I didn't throw up on you, hit me up some time....
author: Angelo F.

description:
Blue Balls on Black Friday need Pink Taco!

Best team name = Free Bottle of Champage! 

Apparently we are flawed (gasp!).  I had come to think our trivia team was unconquerable...but this past week we didn't walk away with the $30 bar tab we've come to expect week after winning week. Good thing we still have something going for us...creativity :)  As reigning champions for the last 4 weeks at Tuesday Trivia, our streak came to an end.  We fell short by only 3 points, but came through with the best team name of the week! Holla playas! Free bottle of champagne works!

FOOD- Yes I go to the Boardroom on Tuesdays for more than just trivia, free bar tabs, and champagne...Tacos!  $2 for Chicken/Steak and $3 for Fish. Yum. All of them yum. Not quite Nick's, but close. Chicken Sliders- $3. Super tasty and not remotely good for your health. Pretty good calamari, and the steak nachos and quesadilla are delish, esp the nachos. Sweet potato fries seem to be a hit/miss. Rest assured the tacos are always the bomb.

Keith and Con are fantastic. Treat them well and they'll hook you up.

See ya Tuesday when we'll once again regain our status as reigning champs and take all you mo fo's down...again.
author: Courtney B.

description:
Soon as we opened the door we were greeted by Carrie - the bartender's dog!  After the sniffing and petting stopped we grabbed a couple stools and ordered our drinks!

The drinks were good, the bartender was very cool, the music was VERY loud and the clientele were friendly.

Actually over friendly and too drunk would be used to describe the wasted couple that stumbled in and sat down I mean, fell down next to us.

the guy spilled his drink down my side which totally pissed me off and I let him know by jamming my elbow into his side and told him to "scoot the fuck over."

They continued to serve drinks to them and they continued to get sloppier.  

When I heard my husband say "i'm going to knock him out" after the guy stumbled into me AGAIN, I knew it was time to go.  Last thing I need on a Saturday night is a bar fight in SF, right?

Regardless of the two a*holes we had a really good time.  I'd go back!
author: Peggy N.

description: Went here for my friend's b'day and had a great time. Good vibes, nice seats, and a great selection of drinks. This is a really good bar.
author: Iroquois S.

description:
Through a combination of setting, food, music, patrons and bartenders, Boardroom earns every star of this review.  The bar itself is nicely appointed, feels clean, and while North Beach isn't my usual stomping grounds I like that it's close to lots of other stuff - at one point I walked around the block to pick up some cannoli.  The menu is solid and served till a decent hour - I had a couple of the fried chicken sliders and I was fucking glad of it.  The music last night was great, there was good company and my bartender handled shit properly - had my first absinthe drink and loved it, strangely enough.

Now for the blah-blah-yelp-reviews-are-full-of-pointless-personal-stories section:  I came here last night for the anti-valentines day party put on by the lovely Berna T., and I gotta say...it was a classy group of people.  I had a good, relaxing time, even if the event made me terribly sad and being in groups of people just reminds me that every man is an island unto himself.  

Melodrama aside, I see why people love this place.
author: Oliver N.

description:
A whoop whoop is what I give the Boardroom. This is one of my favorite bars in SF. Of course I have a slight bias because I live across the street but it truly is a great atmosphere and always has fun people... 

Oh and definitely check out Taco's Tuesdays! The tacos are to die for... :)
author: Megan B.

description:
Visiting from Houston... first establishment ventured to after arriving in SF for new year celebrations with buds... and lucky us, it turned out to be Tuesday Trivia Night. After walking all the way from Powell St. BART station up to there, I was ready to get on with some relaxin'. 

- Cool and chill ambiance (and apparently dog friendly as well - random creatures running around your feet while standing around) 
- Ridiculously cheap and amazing tacos (due to the special salsa?, or grease?, or maybe made more amazing after the tiring walk / day of flight? who knows, but afterwards I was craving them all week long) 
- Fun and diverse crowd. 

Only complaints: 
- the bartenders kind of struck me as douchey, but they kept people entertained and seemed to be on top of 'it' 
- everything outside the tacos seemed to be relatively overpriced 
- witness oregon beating oklahoma state (i hate the pac10) before the 'trivia night' part started 

All in all, seemed to be a nice neighborhood bar and if I lived in the area, I could see myself hanging out there every now and then.
author: Farid R.

description:
Woody Zips is a glorious establishment filled with a delightful assortment of fine spirits and beers.  The bartenders are friendly and knowledgable.

Woody Zips serves one of the finest arrays of pub fare you'll find anywhere.

Woody Zips is an upscale sports bar that sits like a magnet to lure in the kind of folks you'd see roaming the financial district on any given weekday.

Woody Zips is not a "marina" bar.  Although well-groomed and well-dressed, the crowd here always seems to be much friendlier and less pretentious than stereotypical patrons from the neighboring neighborhood.

Woody Zips stocks Miller's Gin.  If you drink Gin, you know why this deserves its own paragraph.

Woody Zips is a bar that I really want to give a five star review.

...I really, really, really do.  They're so very close.  Four and a half stars.  What's holding me back from the full five stars?  The hot wings.  They usually have the best hot wings in the entire world (seriously).  But only when the right chef is in the kitchen.  Otherwise they're just "really freaking good".  The hot sauce is consistently phenomenal.  So what's the difference?  Good question.  Glad you asked.  The answer is how long they're cooked.  My friends and I all agree: when they're cooked almost to the point of being crispy, they're the best!  The last couple of times we were there... undercooked.  So sad.
author: Christopher K.

description:
The bartenders are wonderful.
The drinks well made.
The trivia night matredee is the best in town.
The $2 tacos and the fish tacos are tasty.
The $2 tiger beers are nice on those lean evenings.
Pub quiz is great, even if the movie/music round makes me feel stupid every time.

If you're not going here on tuesday night you are either ill informed or hate america.  Or yourself.  Maybe both.
author: Theron L.

description:
Ladies and Gentlemen, the great Tuesday debate has been solved! No longer do we have to debate Taco Tuesday v. Trivia Night, because Boardroom gives you both!

They've got cheap, greasy tacos, which is all good because their grease tastes gooooood. The nachos are also spectacular, and you can get an Olympia (or four) for $2 a pop. 

Trivia is entertaining and with a wide range of topics. Stick around after your dinner, and get ready for some drinking and thinking!
author: Kelly C.

description:
After reading all of the great reviews about this place I decided, with a little prompting from my roommate, to see what it was all about. Up to this point I was a little hesitant. I remember when this place was Shannons and I wasnt sure someone could turn that dump into something desireable, 

The new owners have done a good job of giving this place a facelift. Completely gutted the place and started over and it is now a somewhat upscale looking sports bar, complete with 4 TVs and local artists work hanging on the walls.

Everyone was friendly. We went on a Monday night and had their fried chicken special ($12 for chicken, some really good mac and cheese and a side of veggies). They were even willing to give us 1.5 orders of it since the three of us each wanted to split an order with one another.

The beer prices seemed a lttle high ($5 a beer) for being off the beaten path a bit. For a bar that is working on being a neighborhood bar rather than a tourist haven they should really think about dropping the prices just a bit.

Overall a pretty cool neighborhood place. I am curious to see how it evolves.

3/9/07 - Update - after spending another evening at Northstar I realized this place deserves an extra star...I forgot how god awful some of the places in good ol' NB can be.

3/17/10 - Update - this bar is no longer Woody Zips (clearly) and I have been back several times since it has changed hands again and become the Boardroom. Some of the food items have changed, but they are all still good, possibly even better, and they have added bottomless mimosas on the weekends so I see there are even further improvements!!
author: Drue C.

description: Best Kick-Ass Bloody Mary Ever - That's all that needs to be said - Thank You.
author: Kelly T.

description:
I am now a regular at the Boardroom's taco Tuesday Trivia night, and currently a member of this week's reigning champion team, "I Went to Vegas to Steal My Shit Back and All I got was this Lousy Conviction."

WoooHooo!

The Boardroom's trivia is definitely not a walk in the park.  5 rounds encompass current events, images, music, movies, and then one specialty round (in the past this has included Russian History, spelling, etc.).  The fish tacos are delectable.    Drinks are cheap until 7 and trivia begins at 8:30.  

Also a bottle of champagne is awarded to the team with the most clever / funny name.  "No Means Yes Means Anal" has won two weeks in a row with probably the most tasteless name ever.  Watch out.  Pull that again and we're going to name ourselves "No Means Yes Means Fisting," if that's what the judges will consider FUNNY.
author: Kerry D.

description:
After our prior incidents, I decided to give the Boardroom another chance.  After our wedding we decided to have a pub crawl throughout North Beach.  I contacted the owner about stopping by his bar for an hour or so.  He got back to me quickly and offered some decent drink specials including $3 bud light, a $6 hornitos Margarita, a $5 Three Olives Grape Vodka and soda, and a $3 shot specials.

This time the bartender was great - nice, attentive and quite the hard worker.  We brought in 35+ people and as the only bartender on staff she hustled to get us all drinks.  People waited a while, but it wasn't for her lack of effort.  Overall, it was a good experience and I would return.
author: Thor M.

description:
Boardroom, I think I have a crush on you. Below is a list of reasons why:

1. This cozy local bar is conveniently down the street from my apartment.
2. Tuesday Trivia night!
    -Oh yeah teams, it's on! 
3. Bingo Wednesdays?! 
4. Taco Tuesdays
    -$2 tacos. The fish tacos rule!
5. 1 shot of Jager & an Olympia=$6.
    -Right on specials! 
6. Drinks & a handful of eats (served until 10-11ish)!
7. Friendly staff
8. Small, clean, and not too loud
9. TV
10. Cash & Credit  (with $20 minimum)

Ooooh dear Boardroom, I will definitely never get "board" of you! ;)
author: Catherine O.

description: This is an Arizona State University football viewing bar - and I love it is packed with my fellow Devil fans.  The bar was packed, and the bartenders are very limited on time and resources.  The bartenders were a lil' snappy because they are so busy...so maybe they should have more there...just a thought?  I didn't eat anything there, but the food sounded great and the people around me said it was good.  Though the service was a little bit of a turn-off, I will go there again for the benefit of the doubt.
author: Stacey D.

description:
A little loud, but the unpretentious atmosphere, interesting drink options and really good food made up for it, especially the surprisingly good tacos (no, seriously, they're magically delicious, sober or not).  Drinks are cheap too, vodka sodas are $5, or $3 during happy hour (5p-7p and 10p-11p).

Trivia night is reeeaaaallllyyy hard - our little team of 3 (Hi Emily!) actually held our own, all things considered, but we still got our asses handed to us, particularly in the movie round.  We've resolved to come back with a vengeance, hopefully with more people.  

It's not Kennedy's, but it too is worth the trek out from my usual haunts.
author: Sus... B.

description:
Have you ever had one of those drunken evenings when you got into a deep debate regarding what the definition of a Cougar is?  Well I have, and it just so happened at Woody Zips.  Now there wasn't a Cougar to be found, but it was a great place to poll the bar.  Low and behold we found a pretty even tie on what a Cougar was, it was great having so many people willing to jump at their chance to put their word on as to what a Cougar was.  

Now on to the Bar, beer a little spendy at $5 a beer, but that is not what stood out at this bar. 

HOT WINGS!!!!!
