Wow I don't know what to say, the best damn wings I have had, only rivaled by a few, their wings were perfectly cooked, with amazing sauce.  So overall, good atmosphere, good people, awesome wings, and a good all around neighborhood bar.

Cheers!
author: Alex R.

description:
This place is like cheers, the guy always remembers your name.

Edit: Let me clarify. I'm not freaking kidding about this OK!?!?!  If you go to this bar and tell the owner your name over your first beer, he will remember when you come in 1 month later, and he'll remember your favorite drink, and your great aunt sally's birthday. It would be a great way to look like a player if the place weren't such a dive, as it stands it's a great way to look like an alcoholic.

Favorite bar in my neighborhood.
author: Tyler W.

description:
Who likes Trivia? I do I do! Tuesday night at the Boardroom are a must. Trivia night starts at 8:30. Drinks are cheap until 7 during happy hour and the 2$ chicken tacos were unbelizable (2 guys at the bar at the shirt on from Belize no joke!)

Con the bartender is awesome. Super friendly and his buddy bartender (can't remember name right now) hooked us up with a free round after refusing to help us with a trivia question. Definitely a good mid-week break in North Beach.

Oh yea, the Trivia host Laura is a gem as well.
author: Kristin M.

description: Just another run of the mill AWESOME bar.  Excellent bartender, clean, good prices, lots of televisions and great bar food.  This place just makes you feel comfortable.
author: Corey V.

description:
As you can tell from most of my reviews, rarely do I venture into the North Beach area.  In fact, this might be my only review from there?  Hmmm, interesting.

I came here with my friend Misha K. (who drives, which is probably the only way I'd end up in North Beach in the first place) He'd recommended taco tuesdays.  (Little did I know it was Tequila, Taco, Trivia, Tuesdays)  We were sort of early enjoying our DELICIOUS cheap beef tacos. (I'm usually a chicken person, but the beef was way better!)  Then the trivia night started up and it started to get crowded.  But in a good way, it wasn't packed, but maybe just...cozy.

So pleasant surprise, we were in the lead the first round of trivia, so we decided to order another round of beer and tacos and stay for the next group of questions.  Mmmmm.  Such a fantastic surprising night for a Tuesday!  I'm totally going back.
author: Mary R.

description:
bacon wrapped tater tots. 6$ fernet and tecate special. i love fernet. i love tots. so far, a win in my book.

i happened to come on a tuesday, and they were having trivia night. place was exceedingly packed. get here at or around 730 if you want a seat.

i love tots. did i say that already?
author: Ben T.

description:
I'm going to go ahead and call/spell it Con. A pronoun. A gentleman's name. As used in the common phrase "Con is the best bartender I know in North Beach," and "I look forward to many nights at the bar being served by Con."

I never knew the previous incarnation of this bar but I don't care. On my FIRST visit, I was treated like and old friend or (beloved) family member. I am not sure I have ever had such a good time, my FIRST time... at a bar. I don't make it to North Beach as often as I wish, but next time? I'll be there. Look for me. I'll buy you a shot.
author: kainoa r.

description: Great place for Tuesday Trivia Night! The girl who runs it is really nice and does a great Job. They have super cheap Tecate and PBR! The tacos here are also outstanding.
author: Jess C.

description:
I don't know why I didn't find this bar earlier!  

It's the perfect size for a neighborhood hangout: (the size of a large room!), the staff is nice, they serve some light food and snacks (tater tots, corn dogs, hummus, fish tacos, fish and chips), the drinks are not expensive and it's not a super young or old crowd (ie. late 20s to young 30s to young 40s).  

Now I have somewhere else to go to in North Beach! Yay!
author: Denise B.

description:
Decent bar right around the corner from my place, so definitely convenient. I think they are having an identity crisis at the moment, trying to be all things to all people. However, I'm sure that will all settle and it'll just be another good bar. Until then you've got your Saturday/Sunday football games, foosball tournaments, Salsa Night, DJ Night, etc...

Update: This also happens to be an OSU fan's safe haven. Since I grew in Columbus and lived there for more than half of my life, this is an added bonus...Go Bucks...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
A great neighborhood find.  They have really, really good wings (vinegary like I like 'em) and tacos.  Pretty crowded Friday night 9pm-ish but not like I wanted to tear my hair out of my scalp. 

They don't know how to make a snakebite (cider + lager; they used cider + Guinness, which is a black velvet).  The 'tender was a bit arrogant and gave us attitude about it, but kinda goes with the joint.
author: Kimberly Q.

description:
Keith has done a good job making this a North Beach staple.  Great atmosphere, good service --- and the food menu gets better and better.

Trivia night is always a blast.  Plus it's sort of a sports bar, depending on what night and what games are on.  Also can be an Oregon Ducks hangout, which earns bonus points from me.

They treat you like you've been there for years.
author: Dan H.

description:
Pretty cool place to meet some friends on a Tuesday night to do some trivia. They keep the questions moving which is nice so the game doesn't last till 1am like some trivia nights and he has some interesting twists to the game which will keep your attention. It's very small so you need to get there about an hour before hand to get one of few tables (on a Tuesday). They have some food as well and i have heard it's decent i have just never found myself hungry there. The nachos looked awesome though i have to admit. 
They have some nice TVs as well and they have the Sunday ticket so you can enjoy watching your team here.
author: Stephen K.

description:
On the way home after an evening in North Beach, we decided to stop in and have a drink at Northstar. I always used to walk by Woody Zips on the way but never went in. As we passed once again, we spontaneously decided to try something different and headed inside.

I've heard that Woody Zips is somewhat of a dive, but it was decorated really well with flat screens, great lighting, cool artwork and colorful painted walls. The beer selection was decent and so cheap- $3 for a draft pint! I got to talking with the bartender Luke and discovered that he is one of the owner's of Woody Zips. He and the other owner live above the bar and named the place after their fathers. After talking some more, he showed us their upstairs private room that can be rented out, which reminds me of Butter's private room- it looks like more like an apartment than a bar.

The clientele was very relaxed and not many people were there, which was exactly what I was seeking in a Wednesday evening. Swapping stories with the bartender (Luke told me about Spec, the old man who owns Specs and can still be seen there) and relaxing with my friend made for a great night. I really feel that this place could become my "neighborhood bar" and can't wait to return.
author: Jessica C.

description: Home of the bacon wrapped tater- tots. How can you go wrong? You can't if you order them with a pint of beer. Great place and easy atmosphere.
author: Paul H.

description: Fantastic BAR in the Heart of North Beach! Great place to watch any sports game and enough TV's and comfortable enough to be watching several at the same time. Great beer selection on draft and attentive barkeeps to keep your glass filled. Keep up the great work!
author: Jack M.

description:
Had to update with an extra star for chill ambiance, Sunday late night happy hour and delicious sweet potato fries.

Is that better Keith? Where's the hot tub??????
author: Lynsey C.

description: We came in to try out Yat's PoBoys, but sadly it is no longer available. So we decided to at least try out the Bacon Wrapped Tater Tots and have a drink. They were really really yummy. The Sunday was a nice gentlemen and really east to talk to. I will definitely be back when I'm in the hood.
author: Christina B.

description: This is an excellent neighborhood bar/dive. Its small and pretty bare bones with old booths and beer buckets that hold utensils and condiments. We walked here for a quick drink and bite to eat before flying out on Sunday. All of our plates were under $10 and the Bloody Mary was awesome.
author: Dave M.

description:
Why do I constantly want to call this place Zippy Woods instead Woody Zips? It's irrelevant I suppose...but still. I went to this place for the first time last night, which happened to be an infamous Taco Trivia Tuesday. You have to give it to them - the tacos were AMAZING. Both the beef and chicken ones were phenomenal. It was completely unexpected and highly appreciated. 

I actually really loved this place. The bar was low-key but alive, the people were not tourists or the over-the-top locals that crawl North Beach at night. They were local people, at a local bar, for a local night of trivia and whatever. The customers were great and were willing to talk to strangers and meet new people.

The bar itself is pretty decent and has a good, small selection of beers including Boont Amber, Guinness, Blue Moon, Red Stripe. They even saluted the neighborhood and had Moretti La Rossa in bottles. The bartender, an interesting fellow named Blake, was pleasant and all about customer service. He wasn't particularly talented, but I truly appreciated the effort and care he put into his job. 

There are a few widescreen plasmas and it's probably a decent place to watch a game. The music was also worth mentioning - what other bar you know plays mid-90's Filter and STP and then switches over to 40's pop? And how could I not give at least 4 stars to a place with a neon Sharks jersey beer sign in the window?
author: Tolga E.

description:
I came here for a breast cancer fundraiser for my friend who was guest bartending.  All the drinks are reasonably priced and they have really good bar food.  

The owner was there and super friendly.  He was helpful about what drinks to order/food to order (AMAZING TACOS).  There are darts in the back.  The bathroom is pretty clean.  

I'm sure I'll be there again!
author: Angela S.

description:
After a very bad experience at Elephant and Castle's trivia night about a year ago, I've been searching for another Trivia place for awhile. The Boardroom is PERFECT!

We showed up on Tuesday at 6 and they put the debate on their three big flat screen tvs. We all ordered tacos ($2) and Olympia ($2) and were very pleased with the beef, chicken, and fish tacos. They even made a vegetarian taco for my veggie friend!

After the debate ended the bar started to get really crowded. Everyone was showing up for Trivia Night. My team, The Answer is Five, was tied for first place up until the spelling round where we got destroyed...sad :(

I will definitely be coming back and I'm already recruiting spellers for next week. The trivia was great. They did a music round with clips of songs and a movie round with video played on the tvs. They had a name that person, picture round and then a few round of random information ranging from Current Events to Sports to Pop Culture. 

The bar isn't that big but it's very nice inside. They have chairs along the wall, a couple tables in the corner and a couch and some comfy chairs near the back. They also have a second bathroom in the "storage closet" in case you really need to go.

I'm really glad I checked this place out. Their sign is black and red and not inviting but now that I know what it's like inside, I'm planning to spend a lot of time there. 

They also do Bingo night on Wednesdays!
author: Jackie G.

description:
They definitely have bottomless mimosa's!  I didn't eat, but it looked like they had some breakfast burrtio's and such.  They also had brugers and tacos - so you will find something no matter what your tastes.

The mimosa's are $12 each - enjoy!
author: Megan H.

description: Small and quaint but perfectly efficient...the Steve Nash of sports bars.
author: Nathan K.

description:
Looking for an upscale sports bar in North Beach that the girlfriends will like just as much as the guys?  This is it.  I was in there again last night and it was packed - with just as many women as guys.  I think this place actually 'has it all.'

The owners gutted the old nasty Shannon's sports bar & completely remodeled it as a chic sports bar - it's definitely on my favorites list now - especially since my drink is waiting on me by the time I get to the end of the bar!  Got cool owners, a sweet bar and good beer on tap.  There are 4 monster flat screens around the place to provide your sports fix.  The menu isn't exactly expansive, but everything on it is tasty!

And thank god there's finally something hanging on the walls.  I don't have an extra $14K laying around for the one painting I want so I'm actually contemplating becoming an art thief...
author: Double D.

description: Cheap drinks, friendly staff, fun atmosphere, clean bathroom, patrons choose the music. I'm adding this to my list of dive bars to revisit on the weekends!
author: Kevin W.

description:
Nothing distinctly special or wrong about this spot, but I think I'll have to go back on a Tuesday to check out their special for the fish tacos.

The good thing is that it's not tourist filled and more a locals joint.  Of course I was there on a Monday and the only one there for a bit.  Luckily the bartender was nice and attentive so she definitely is solid.
author: Gene X.

description:
Lots of locals... when I have been it has been really cramped... but it is a good time to pass the time with friends... met some interesting people there too... I prefer locals hangouts and sometimes they aren't as easy to find in NB anymore... too many B&T people coming over...

On a personal note... this place was the beginning to an end... It just shows how I don't hold grudges... I could have easily have given them 1 star for the bad memories.. but it is not their fault I had too many libations and the rest is history.. LOL
author: Amelia M.

description:
I like this place, but I'm not in love. I usually end up here because Northstar is too crowded. 

I will say that the bartenders are friendly. Their pours are generous and even more generous during Happy Hour. Luke is my favorite.The bar food is awesome. The chips and salsa (chips are deep fried), the burger (is huge) and the sweet potato fries are insane! My favorite thing about this place is that they serve corn dogs. Yes I've tried them and no I prob won't eat them again. However, they serve corn dogs and they serve a variety! They have your traditional dog, a lamb dog and a turkey dog. Use your imagination.

So they serve corn dogs and they have my poison of choice: Absolut Ruby Red. Honestly, what more could you want?
author: Jenny S.

description: Friendly crowd. Awesome bartenders. What more can you ask for??? Oh yes I know. Taco trivia Tuesdays !! I think I have a sick obsession for trivia. You get 2 dollar tacos that injects your brain with magical powers to answer these asinine trivia questions. It's so much fun when you get play with a full house. Sometimes I wonder if these people just sit there and read stupid current events all day. OVERALL...I LOVE IT!! Alcohol + tacos + trivia = PURE HAPPYNESS
author: Ronald C.

description:
I found this place last Tuesday on Yelp randomly and went for Trivia Night on a fluke. I got there ridiculously early coming straight from work, but Mr. Bartender Keith made me feel welcome while I waited for my teammate (even though I was alone and looked like a loser- couldn't even call my voicemail and pretend to be on the phone because this place is where the T-Mobile signal goes to die).

There were only 2 of us so I am proud to say we didn't suck terribly, but the trivia definitely makes you use your brain. We even won a bottle of champagne for our team name (but I think Keith was just being extra nice!) 2 dollar tacos and tecate, I'm sold. I'll be back tonight with a bigger and better team!

**Update** 9/4/08

Went back this past Tuesday and won! yay for team trig & track!
author: Briana J.

description:
I love the feeling that I get when I walk into my local, favorite bar. I haven't gotten this feeling since my hayday in Chico until I met up with some new and old friends at The Boardroom.

In search of a bar playing the OSU game on a Thursday night, my friend called the bar in the afternoon. He was lucky enough to get the owner, Keith, who assured him he would play his game that evening. Sure enough, a man of his word, Keith had it on the big screen and we bellied up to a tall table surrounded by bar stools. 

We were greeted like we had been coming to The Boardroom for years. The guest bartenders, which on Thursday nights take cash tips for different charities, were really friendly and fast. And, by the end of the night we had met the usual staff, and we were chatting it up.

I now know about the trivia night and the fish tacos, so you may see me swaying about on my barstool on Tuesday's (taco in one hand, beer in the other). Thanks for the hospitality! We all walked away saying what a great new place to make our favorite neighborhood bar.
author: Natalie N.

description: The Boardroom recently hosted the launch party for my small business. Now, since we're just starting out, we don't have money to just throw around. No matter, The Boardroom let us have it there...for free! No problem. Buy food from us, or bring in your own - no problem. Decorate the place with balloons and tablecloths and napkins (we're girls, obviously) - no problem. Play your own music (for all they know it could've been a Taylor Swift nightmare. It wasn't) - no problem. Buy back the champagne we over-ordered - no problem. Just the nicest, most accommodating bunch of guys. Truly.
author: Becky R.

description:
The Boardroom is one of the more solid North Beach bars, with a terrific selection of beer and food.  I would have definitely given it a higher rating if it  weren't for a few things that I've noticed over the past two years.

The Good:
1) Solid Tuesday trivia night - a little long for my taste, but the questions are always pretty solid, and the $2 Tacos are amazing.
2) Terrific laid back atmosphere with the owners and bartenders dogs roaming the floor for scraps, and some good seating areas.
3) It's selection of both high end and cheap beer is amazing.  Anytime a bar serves Olympia and PBR you know you have a solid establishment.
4) By far the best bloody mary in all of North Beach
5) The bartenders and owners are super nice.

The Bad
1) The food has gone somewhat downhill.  They used to have amazing burgers and pretty good wings (I'm from Buffalo so I probably have higher wing standards than most), but since changing over to the Boardroom from Woody Zips, it hasn't been quite as good (they do serve a solid meatloaf sandwich though).  Still the last time I ordered a burger I was less than impressed.  It also seems as though the fries aren't as good as I once remembered.  In their defense I know that they've gone through a bunch of chefs over the past few months which would explain the downgrade. 

2) When it's crowded the service can be a little on the slow side, and due to the layout of the bar it can be really difficult to get the bartenders attention (I realize this isn't the only place).

3) $20 credit card minimum can be annoying.
author: Patrick C.

description:
The Boardroom is as good as it gets.  The food is amazing, they do not freeze any of their meats, and the drinks are cheap.  Happy hour there is pretty outstanding as well.  If you are on a budget, you can get a shot, a beer, and a large plate of nachos for $13.  
the Bartenders top notch as well.  Martin makes a bloody Mary that will knock you on your back side... in a good way.  it's got some heat.  And while I was there last night I found out that the idea for bacon wrapped tater-tots came to the workers in a drunken stupor which makes it all the better.  
I just moved into the city in November of 2011 and The Boardroom is easily my favorite bar. The food alone is worth going for.
side note, the chicken sandwich is the best sandwich on the menu and i recommend trying it with a fried egg on it.  I know it sounds a little weird but it is delicious.

Do yourself a favor and go to The Boardroom
author: Corey h.

description:
Tuesday is Two-Dollar Taco Trivia Tuesday (the most alliterative night in town, apparently).  I go for the tacos.  And the trivia.  Delish.  And smart.

A few tips: Trivia starts at 8:30ish, but all the seats are gone by 8.  They stop serving tacos early and they run out even earlier, so order a table full as soon as you get there.  DON'T heckle the trivia master - he makes up all his own trivia questions and does all the hard work so that you can sit there with your friends feeling smart (or dumb) so don't HASSLE him.
author: Jess S.

description: Went to the Boardroom for the 2nd time this past Tuesday.... great bartender / forgot his name / great $2 tacos, $2 Tecates, fun rounds of trivia (we sucked), and a bunch of really friendly patrons - exactly what I want in a (slightly divey) neighborhood bar.
author: O. I.

description:
I have only experienced Woody Zips on a Tuesday evening (for Two-Dollar Taco Trivia Tuesdays) - but based on Tuesdays alone, the place is a lot of fun. It's pretty small and cozy, and after only going to trivia for a few weeks, you'll get to know everyone that's working there.
The tacos are definitely yummy and the trivia is a lot of fun (the trivia starts at 8:30 and normally goes from anywhere around 10 to almost 11 - seven rounds including 10 minute music and movie rounds take time).
Also, the drinks are reasonably priced and after trivia ends get even cheaper!
author: Rachel L.

description: The Boardroom was a great place to watch a few of the Bowl games today. Tots!? Excellent.
author: CE R.

description:
It's hard for me to give a North Beach "dive" bar higher than 3 stars since you automatically pay a premium to drink in the neighborhood. I think the bar should at least give you something "extra" for that premium. This bar doesn't do anything special as far as I could tell. Really it seemed like it was just full of drunk 25-35 yr old dudes trying to relive their early 20's or college days. 
The two good things 1. Trumer on tap...2. I've been there for private parties/guest bartender nights when friends of mine were bartending. Bars that support local events are cool. I'd rather go to the happy hour at Columbus Cafe. 
Stay Tru Boardroom.
author: Mike M.

description:
very good food, great bar selections, friendly service!  I wouldnt really call it a sports bar except for the fact that yes, you can see sports on the TV...4 plasmas i might add..just doesnt have a sports bar vibe, much nicer that way if you ask me...lets see, burger was great, fried macorni and cheese balls were a first, also delicious...and the steak and blue cheese salad was perfect....good dressing, sauteed onions, hard to beat!

highly reccommenenededded
author: cab k.

description:
Golf pub crawl hole #5 ouf 9 (Saturday)

The word of the day is MUFFIN TOP.

Have you ever seen a person who tried to squeeze into a piece of clothing that was just too tight and over flows out of that garment?  Well trying to fit 40 people on a golf pub crawl in Woody Zips small frame when there are 20 drinkers already there is just like that.  I had a good time, but the quarters were muffin top.  

The bartenders were friendly and the decor was nice.  I'd like to go when I have more room.
author: Po L.

description:
Nice. Kind of off the Beaten North Beach path is the Board Room.  The only time I find myself in North Beach is late at night grabbing a late bite to eat if I'm feeling something Italian.

The Board Room is a pretty cool spot  that made me feel comfortable to be the only black male in the spot  I was a little self conscious at first but after my first martini that was really  good I was cool.  I even got some props for rockin my Naruto beanie.

The Board Room is a clean little spot even though I made a mess with my tasty chicken sliders.  The spicy  sauce and jalepenos made it one for the ages!  I kind of wish I would have stuck around for a bit a had the chicken nachos but I had places to be. 

I'm kind of glad I went for the Anti-Valentine's Day party  that Berna La Glam hosted. I didn't meet her but I'm sure I met a few other yelpers that were having a good time but I didn't anounce myself as a yelper.  I don't want to feel like I'm apart of some kind of cult lol.  
I did kind of fancy the girl in the red top and red heels she was like 6 drink a head of me. The one thing that made me reflect about anti valentines day is how much I miss my party girl and best friend. I really wish it could have worked out in my favor... 
No more  sob stories
author: Karim R.

description:
Mission: Taco Tuesday Venue 3

We were the first in the bar at 6pm... great for us because we didn't have to wait to order beers or Tacos. $2 chicken and steak tacos were pretty delicious... especially liked the soft shell that was slightly fried. We discovered that they do $2 tacos all the time, leading us to ponder perhaps a Taco Thursday? But I digress...

Started with Blue Moon on tap, then had a Tiger Beer (yay Asia!), then devolved to bottles of PBR. Seems like the drink of choice for most others that night was the $2 Olys though.

Spent between 6 and 8:30pm getting a good buzz on and chatting up the bartender (Shout Out Keith!).

Trivia started around 9 and, well, we sucked. But it was a blast and we were thoroughly happy when we left at 11:15. Next time our team name will be: Drinking our way to last place. (Oh, and it wasn't overly crowded... maybe we picked an off night.)

Only Con: Between two smaller ladies, each having 2 tacos and then a shared round of $5 happy-hour-special nachos, we still managed to rack up a tab of more than $50. Eeks. Oh well.
author: Shannon B.

description: How can you not love Boardroom? The drinks are great and always on a special... the food is fantastic. If you have never experienced their sliders, you are missing out! I was introduced to this place well over a year ago and will continue to frequent whenever I am around. Make sure you try their bloody mary! Nothing but the best things to say!
author: Brent M.

description:
The Boardroom serves as the commemorative site of the launch of my new signature drink. Mandarin Vodka (Grey Goose l'orange preferrably) and soda. So I went to the nerd braggade that is known as Trivia Night and drank so many of said new orangie cocktails that I actually loved the fish taco's. I'm told that it is just fish sticks cut up but ah well, they sure made my tummy happy, and my body just a tad bit more sober. 

Minus one star for being an ugly dive bar. Another off because their trivia consisted of New York Times articles and whatever the hell is happening in China. If that is trivia then tell me the name of the place I have to go to to use my expert knowledge of anything that is aired on E! Bravo MTV and Vh1. No this isn't a rant, I liked the place and had tons o fun. Thanks Anna K.!
author: Lauren B.

description:
Oh the days I used to stay in SF and WoodyZips was a stonesthrow away... I really miss this place and the deconstructed CORN DOGS! anyone who can serve up 3 amazing corndogs for $8 is automatically amazing...

and I guess I should also mention the awesome bartenders and the friendly people who love to kick it at this establishment too!
author: Chrysantha C.

description:
I ordered a vodka soda and was served vodka with flat soda and a lime. There are really only two liquid ingredients to this drink! Moreover, it is so standard that any bar that is practicing the business of making drinks needs to get it right. It was like drinking vodka mixed with water.

My boyfriend, who claims to love Boadroom in a four-star-kind-of-way, ordered a beer. When I finished forcing down the gross vodka soda I asked him to order me the same beer that he had. He said, "Uh, I do not think you want this beer." It was a beer, what could be wrong with it? Warm and flat. I learned that the hard way.

I was completely underwhelmed in a neighborhood with so many bars. We had some snacks which were fine--typical deep fried bar food. The crowd was eclectically entertaining. That is why Boardroom does not get one star. There are surfing photos and snowboard bindings mounted to the walls as decor.
author: Andrea F.

description:
The Boardroom is a bar I really wanted to dislike, and I know that sounds mean but I'll tell you why. 

The bar that is The Boardroom was once the bar that was Woody Zip's. Sure the name might not have been as clever but Woody Zip's had, and I @#$% you not, the best Buffalo Wings I have ever had. Ever. I don't know what happened or why the name went, but those oh so epic wings went with it.

And alas, all was lost. 

So I when I returned to this bar with quite the humbug attitude, just looking for a reason to rail on it, I found that it's still a super fun North Beach spot.  
Despite it being a small space, the place can get super busy on the Friday / Saturday nights. Loud music and large groups are a staple. The bartenders are really nice and super fun, the folks in here are typically friendly and having a great time. The place is essentially just like the bar I remember it to be, minus those golden god-like wings.

The food here is still pretty damn good bar food and they have some good happy hour specials too. 

So, as much as I don't want to admit the new girl is just as much fun as the old flame I had, I'll give The Boardroom a thumbs up.  

Dear Woody Zips, we'll always have our wings 

xoxox 
~Andy
author: Andy A.

description: very few places in SF a local can go to on a Friday not and not get annoyed.  Boardroom is one of them.  GREAT bartenders. local crowd.  looks like it might be a great place to catch the games.  two thumbs up.
author: Angela N.

description:
I have, from Woody Zips to Boardroom, always been impressed with this divey little locals haven.  TVs, games, blaring iPod music (that you CAN ask to have turned down if it's really bothering you), swell staff, and pretty awesome burgers (and food in general).  

I've only visited on afternoons, so can't really say anything for the crazy (or lack thereof) nights.  But all in all, I would say it's a great alternative to other similar joints in the neighborhood.
author: Giorgina G.

description: Kickass! Martin (the bartender) remembered my boyfriend and after we hadn't been there since basketball season. He even remembered that we had just started dating then. Impressive!
author: MacKenzie P.

description:
You know those great local bars in your neighborhood or your friend's neighborhood that you always have fun at and would come back at the drop of the hat? The boardroom is that kind of spot. I have same I'm somewhat biased because this is the unofficial ASU bar and as a proud alum here in San Fran its not always easy to find. 

Tuesday night is really fun too, cheap tacos and $2 beer. One of my favorite places to come and watch a basketball or football game and relax. Food and drinks are both great and def not expensive compared to the other places in the neighborhood. There's even a parking garage literally next door that makes it really easy if you're travelling by car. Highly recommended!
author: J D.

description: Really nice and helpful bartender. Menu looks good. I like this place.
author: Johanna W.

description: Good eats, good company, a little out of the way so you don't get so much of the marina overflow.
author: Justine K.

description: Okay, so the owner/manager reached out to me in response to my 1-star review with a sincere apology for my experience and urged me to come back and try The Boardroom again. Since he took the time to reach out and address me as a dissatisfied customer, and because it looks like this place does well the majority of the time, I'll be sure to try them again if I am in the area. Thank you for taking the time to address my concerns.
author: Rachel H.

description:
As one of my new year's resolutions, I've decided to start writing reviews regularly rather than being a Yelp leech.  So I'm starting with the Boardroom, where I watched the BCS Championship game.  With no specific loyalties, it was fun to watch at what was clearly an Oregon bar.  

Best thing about the place is their food.  Being a vegetarian, food at bars usually sucks, but their wild mushroom melt was delicious.  Probably one of the best sandwiches I've ever gotten.  Good drink specials during the game too with $2 Coors Light tall cans and some weird $2 Hef deal that lasted about a minute.

Minus one star for pretty filthy bathrooms.
author: Olivia T.

description:
Settled, home-y vibe. The drinks are decently priced and they carry at least one off-beat beer, which is refreshing. The furniture was kind of awkwardly arranged. 

Seems like there's usually a bouncer outside, though they're not that serious about IDs.
author: Chris L.

description:
Pretty good spot ... North Beach is not my fave ... and the crowd at most places out there can be so so but this place was not too bad. 

My drinks were poured a little on the weak side (I like to order tall drinks cuz I drink so fast) the bartender/I think owner actually MEASURED my shot of whiskey! :(  .. it seemed like he measured even less than a three count.
Anyway, the trivia night was pretty fun and the food looked good. 
I'll probly be back if I'm lookin for somethin to do on a Tuesday... 
Next time I'll go hungry :) and order beer PBR's :)
author: Jeremy R.

description: I'm in San Francisco for two days so I decided to search Yelp for a good bar to watch the playoffs. All the reviews here said this was the place to be. The bartender seemed to favor the people sitting at the bar who appear to be locals, and was a tad rude. Breakfast Po' Boy wad very tasty and the Bloody Mary I ordered was perfect. I got my hopes up a bit for The Boardroom so we're leaving at half time to find another place. 3 stars
author: Tommy N.

description:
Went into Woody Zips twice this weekend. Well once if you want to be technical...First time started with great beer, decent crowd, and friendly bouncers/bartenders. 

Cut to mid way through the day, come back with a bigger crowd. It's St. Patties day I know the place is packed we must wait in line, no biggie. The ass at the door lets half of my group in, it's obvious btw that we're all together in a group. Then puts his hand out to stop me, "How  many in your group?'  I reply, "Um we're with them." My friend comes back and  wants to know why only half the group got in. I make what I thought was a humorous crack and say "Apparently our kind are not welcome in there."..Comment not taken well. He flips out and then proceeds to tell me how I am not welcome in his establishment, my kind won't be tolerated and that I am  rude. WOW!!!!!!! Here is the funny thing, I was pretty sober at this point and I'm only five feet tall, not some brooding drunk giant. Do I appear to be the bar brawling type? How do you 86 someone that can bearly see over the bar??!!?? lol

I'm saddened I feel like this bar had serious potential. I will never set foot in there again "as my kind are not tolerated."


***UPDATE: So I have yet to go back to this bar, but I'm going to update my review anyhow. After reading my not-so-nice review, I was contacted by both owners. AWESOME! Yelp justice at it's finest. They both apologized and I believe I have a beer with my name on it  next time I visit. It's nice to know that the owners care about their bar and the patrons. Thanks guys! ;)
author: Erica A.

description:
Woody Zips is a cool little neighborhood bar; definitely a nice spot to relax with some of your buddies, a beer, and watch the game. The two guys who recently set this place up are nice, and didn't hesitate to give my friend and I some free shots on a slow night. In the several times that I have been there, its small space has been pretty packed... A good sign that business is doing well. It may seem to attract a large number of marina-types, but this can be easily tolerable when in a good mood.

Overall a comfortable, small neighborhood bar that certainly warrants stopping in for a drink while journeying through North Beach.
author: Aaron J.

description:
Love this place--great corner bar to go to any day of the week
1.  Strong drinks -- great prices -- $2 Olympias at times too
2. Nice bartenders
3. Good food -- Really cheap too!
4. Low key most of the time (on occasion -especially on trivia night it gets a little packed and it is a little rowdy in there-- its usually not too bad though)
Overall, never a bad choice when looking for somewhere to go!
author: Amy B.

description:
So i totally love playing games and the fact that their is a bar that provides a fun trivia night is totally SWEET. . . the trivia was entertaining and somewhat informative. Sometimes it was hard to hear cuz everyone was talking and i did see people cheating which takes a litle bit of the fun out of it. but the $2 tacos looked really good. . .

however. . . they do NOt pour their drinks very strong. My first drink was strong but for some reason he thought i wouldn't notice that the second one was not. . . not sure why bartenders do this. It's not gonna make me less drunk i;m just not gonna order drinks from here.Just pour me the same drink EVERYTIME. If you don't i'm gonna be a grummpy drunk NOT a HAPPY drunk. I have to say though if your into cheap beer this is the place to go. 
The establishment itself is not very big so get their early if your going for trivia. And they are guilty of my biggest pet peive... not having the coat hooks under the counters to put your purse or jacket. BIG FAIL THERE. It was really stuffy and hot. as far as the crowd it's North beach...need i say more
author: Diana Elena B.

description: A great neighborhood bar whose bartenders are always nice. Surprisingly the food is good too, a much needed item when I find that my Happy Hour has run longer into the night than planned! And who can really complain about a bar that has Fernet specials!!!
author: Kristi E.

description:
Great local spot.  They have something going on every day of the week and always have a decent game on 1 of the 4 flat panel tv's.  Taco/Trivia Tuesday is a must do, the steak taco's are BOMB.  They have a foosball table most of the time so it s a great place to get your foos on if it's not too crowded.  

Overall its one of my favorite North Beach hangouts.
author: Ryan G.

description:
I've been here twice and it's great. I've been looking for a good local bar that doesn't seem like a run-down frat house for awhile now. I was drinking there all day one Saturday and of course, that got out of hand quickly, but it's a great place to sit at the bar, meet a few people, and have some really great apps. 

On Trivia night it was pretty serious, and very packed. I swear the team behind me was cheating and took my team's answers... but then again I would too if I heard a team shout out every answer we picked for everyone to hear. Thanks Brett and Tom. We could've taken the place by STORM!
author: Tim Y.

description:
I *HEART* Taco Tuesdays.  Mmmmmm.....
More than that, they have at least one Deschuttes Brew on tap at any point in time (at least the bartender said so, so it better not change!).  I think the word is getting out though, so we have got to get another guy in the kitchen to get those tacos whipped up!  And maybe another to pour beers :)
Definitely a cool happy hour spot.
author: Amie W.

description:
This place was definitely cooler than I expected. Cruised in here Friday night because a friend said he knew the bartender. We proceeded to sit at the bar and booze it up. The drinks were perfectly made. The crowd happy, friendly, and a little wacky. Except for the way too drunk popped collar chode who was upset that Paris had to go back to jail. That was too much for me to resist. I HAD to bite. We ended up having a loud roaring debate on whether Paris Hilton was a victim of her celebrity. Almost sends me into a rage just writing it...
Obviously the crowd was on my side and we only made the PH lover cry a little bit. :-)
author: Ed V.

description: I stayed across the street from the Boardroom where the people I stayed with were regulars. They took me (at 9am) and had fun! When I came back to SF, I didn't stay with those friends but I made damn sure to go back to the Boardroom. It was a rainy monday night and there was hardly anyone there but the bartender loved us, chatted us up, and took pictures for us. He even thought of fun pictures for us to take. haha! I will, without a doubt, go back.
author: Laurin M.

description: Love these Guys! Definitely a great place to go for a beer and watch a game with some great bar food.
author: C M.

description: I'm all about Taco Tequila Trivia Tuesday. The host is a fantastic lady, and they seem to put a lot of effort and thought into it. Decent beer selection, and fun times for all!
author: Jill H.

description: Can you say Hipster special..... PBR and a shot of Jamie for $7 any night of the week.... I say yes please. The regulars are good people, but you do get the occasional douche bag coming in already from another bar. The bartenders are great....
author: Melvin T.

description: So I really wasnt goin to go out on St Patty's Day but it was a long week at work I think I deserve one nite of being shit faced.  Just finished having dinner and a bunch of soju before heading over here to meet up with some friends.  It is very true the place is not very big so it just makes it even that better getting cozy up to ur neighbor. From the door guy to the bartenders were a good group of guys...especial Ben who for some reason seemed to like to give me a hard time out of my group.  But then again my group was kinda hard to handle taking up that whole corner near the window singing and taking pics. The crowd for being st. patty's was actually very laid back and merry...no drunk fools acting up and causing fights (aka Molly Magee's). I am truly sorry Ben for my friends and how loud we were but then again thanks for that cup of water u over flowed onto the bar...lol...were u tryin to get me wet? But thanks for the hug. It was a good nite...i got the bruises to prove it!
author: Christine M.

description: Basic north beach bar. Nothing fancy, but gets the job done. The food menu was a little on the pricey side...$8 for seven mozzarella sticks?!?!
author: Kathleen E.

description:
my new favorite trivia night spot. $2 tacos($3 for the delectable fish taco) and $2 olympias all night on tuesday's. great way to get your grub on, get fucked up, and have a fun night of trivia for cheap. trivia lasts for about 2 hours with several rounds. 1 round was a picture of mugshots(i cant believe i didnt get shia lebouf, wynona judd, and james brolin...), 1 round was a weird "clue" like game that involved big and small cum-stains(dont ask...), 1 round was 1 minute movie clips to see if you could gess the title, other rounds were simply questions with different themes.

the trivia host was super cool and cute and knew her shit. she had to yell out the questions all night because the mic was broken, but never a complaint. the bartenders were cool, even throwing out an old dude that kept yelling out answers. this place is right on the edge of north beach and a definite great spot. looks like we may be doing a few UYE's here so check the events page for tuesdays.
author: Andrew T.

description: Before my friend moved to Chicago, he used to frequent this place.  I wish that I had joined him more often.  This place is so good and dangerously close to home.  Attended a party here on a weeknight when I'm sure that it was much busier than usual, but I was extremely impressed with the quality of the service.  Bartender is extremely friendly and kept everyone's glass at least half full throughout the night.  Best surprise was the bar food.  In my opinion, its some of the best bar food in the city.  Tater tots in North Beach?  A fierce looking meatloaf sandwich.....the cuisine features all the comforts of your Midwest native roots, which are of course  best in moderation.  Can't wait to return for the chicken and waffles!
author: Amy Z.

description:
the boardroom very quickly became my favorite sports bar in sf. the drinks are cheap, the food is above average, and, most importantly, the staff is amazingly friendly.

in my book, only kezar pub bests the boardroom in the sf wings department, so give those a try, but not before you devour a plate of bacon-wrapped tater tots...what a genius idea.
author: Jon W.

description: If nothing else, I love this place for the tater tots. There is nothing like a bloody mary and an order of tater tots and waffles to cure a hangover on New Year's Day. The bartender was awesome. We thought we would have to order from the bar, but he came out and took care of us. He was rowdy, as am I, and he makes the bloody mary's spicy. It is a great brunch/day-drinking spot, but I'm not sure if I would go there to drink at night. It started to fill up with football fans in the early afternoon, and took on a more Marina vibe. I got hit on by a guy that was 6 years younger than me and it made me feel like a cougar, but I am just a puma.
author: Merrilee T.

description: I just got home from trivia at the Boardroom. Not the best trivia night I've ever been to, but the f-ing $2 tacos were incredible, and the cheap Olympias and Pabsts were not too shabby, neither.
author: Jason R.

description: This place is as good as it gets when it comes to bars. We were heading from Fisherman's Wharf back to our hotel in Union Square around 5:30 and noticed a dog inside. My wife and her friend stopped to pet the dog and we wound up having a few rounds of drinks, enjoying talking to the patrons and bartender. Everyone was extremely nice, they had an above average selection of beers on tap, and they had good happy hour deals. They also have a jukebox smartphone App that my wife was obsessed with (you can download the app and pick songs to be played for the entire bar). I had written off the entire city of San Francisco as a tourist trap until we found this place. I was really happy to search for it on Yelp and find that it is well received. The Boardroom is definitely a place I would go to all the time if I lived in SF.
author: Tom N.

description: I really want to make the Boardroom my new Moe's (See: Moe's Crosstown Tavern, Charleston, SC) but I just can't.   I love the homemade corndogs and the bacon wrapped tater tots are awesome, but the burger just doesn't do it for me.  Cheap drinks are a plus.  Check out the beer and shot specials including the dirty hipster - $6 for PBR and Jameson.
author: dan d.

description:
hmm....

3 flat screen tvs?
amazing, spicy, bloody marys?
one of the best, spiced, burgers in town?
hot girls?
not too expensive?

i guess i'll be watch a lot more sporting events here
author: Steve S.

description: I love this bar. It has that certain je ne sais quoi you look for in a local bar. There's a great trivia night on Tuesdays. It's perfect spot to watch a game. The bar staff is fun and entertaining. I have been there many times when the bartender makes a round of shots for the whole bar. The burgers are awesome, but don't always expect the kitchen to be open.
author: C J.

description: this place has cheap happy hour food and some cute resident dogs, but it is really REALLY white--like Boston Red Sox fans, Fratty, DAR white.
author: Peter C.

description: I have only been for Taco Tequila Trivia Tuesday -  a great trivia night.  Great beer prices (for SF North Beach) and cheap tacos (2$) on Tuesday nights while playing trivia.  Small place, can get a bit cramped, and the food is nothing special- typical bar food, but the bartenders are great- friendly and quick.  I don't know about the other 6 nights a week.
author: Owen S.

description: Good music and pretty good vibe. They have lots of alcohol and can even make a french martini!
author: Natalie S.

description: My favorite bar in SF ! Everyone is so friendly and they always have great specials and amazing food ! $3 Magners on Tuesdays and great $2 Tacos!
author: Jackie P.

description: A few weeks ago, a couple of my college friends from Ohio were in town, and the weekend of their stay just happened to coincide with the OSU-Texas game.  I got the tip that Zeke's is where most Buckeye fans go, but we got there late and there was a line.  We took a cab to North Beach to look around for a place to watch the game, and by some miracle we stumbled upon Woody Zips.   They didn't have much of a food menu yet, but sweet potato fries were all we needed to see.  They were awesome.   Overall, the place seems to have a great atmosphere, and is a very cool addition to the neighborhood.
author: Andy G.

description: Trivia night is a lot of fun. I think the music and Movie questions were a little too hard but everything else was fun. We have never won the game but we did win a free bottle of Champagne for the most original name! It was George Carlin's 7 words!! You know the ones! :)
author: Stacey L.

description: Great North Beach neighborhood bar, with a surprising variety of good food, friendly bartenders, and a good selection of well made drinks.
author: Lee N.

description: Tasty bar fare (sweet potato fries), cheap drinks, couch, extremely friendly owner, nice bartenders and a kick ass Tuesday trivia night.
author: Christina S.

description: Definitely a hidden find in North Beach.  Tucked away on the corner of Powell and Beach Blanket Babylon St.  A good place to grab a quick pint while chatting with some friendly locals!
author: James C.

description: Caroling pub crawl was well received.  Bartender was great and crowd was awesome.  Order the pitchers of mimosa.  Highly recommend.
author: Ian M.

description: Quite a bit nicer than the average sports bar. Even the ladies like it.
author: Patrick B.

description: Great spot!  Truth be told, I've generally been frequenting the bars with freshly squeezed juice kind of cocktails.  Must say though, they rock the cocktails here despite not squeezing the pineapples and cranberries onsite.  Welcoming vibe, good drinks, great prices.  Fun bartender who clearly loves what he is doing.  I will be back!  Didn't see any sign of food menus, however, so not sure about any of that, but again.... I will be back!
author: Danielle R.

description: Woody Zips is a really cool neighborhood bar. I have been a few times now and I always have a good time. Bartenders are really friendly and pour some strong drinks. Not really sure I would call this place a sports bar, but if you are looking for a laid back place to have some drinks, I would recommend this place!!
author: Lisa A.

description: This place gets 5 stars just for its Tuesday trivia night. I'm not even that into trivia, but I always enjoy it here. The atmosphere is chill--no frills, but it's a clean, cozy place. Food always entices me, and their tacos are surprisingly out of this world for a sports bar! $2 for chicken, but I recommend the $3 fish--it's covered in a savory sauce that beats Mijita's fish tacos in the Ferry Building. The only problem is it's not that big, so it gets crowded on trivia night.
author: Jenni L.

description: Great place to have a drink and definitely have a bite to eat.  The food here is much better than in most pub / bar establishments.  The personality changes depending on the day and time.  It can be a lively music filled place, a play bingo and trivia place, a great bar to enjoy drinking with friends, and definitely  a place to enjoy some football or baseball.
author: Robert W.

description: Fun, fun, fun.  The folks at Woody Zips are super-cool and so are the patrons.  The guys are laid back and allow people to "guest bartend" on Wednesdays.  I did it along with a friend to raise money for a charity -- it was a huge success financially (can't say as much for my friend's livers).  This is a great place to go, especially if Northstar gets too dirty or crowded, just crawl across the intersection and belly up to the bar.  Also major bonus points for their bathroom: the bathroom is cleaner and infinitely roomier than many of the bathrooms in North Beach.  They also have tons of beers on draft and good drink specials.  Oh, almost forgot, they also have a kitchen, so they can fill your belly with good grub too.
author: Jamie F.

description: $3 Fish Tacos on Tuesday.  That alone should make you come.  The shells are a perfect mix between soft and hard, and the other ingrediants as fresh as they come.  The sweet potato fries were decent too--a little soggy, but they had that great earthy and sweet taste.  The bartenders are wonderful, just like Theron says.  If you're into a fruit punch, refreshing, slightly alcoholic girly drink, ask for the Kerry Berry.  It's named after one of the 'tenders puppy dogs, and it was a great compliment to the sweet potato fries.  Guys, it's pink, so you might want to get your gal pal to order it for you.  If you're going on Tuesday--get there before 7 or you won't get a seat for trivia fun.  This is a small, friendly neighborhood place.  We'd never been there before but they treated us as if we were regulars.  With food and service like that, we just might become just that!
author: melissa g.

description:
We held our fantasy football draft here.  We had a great time.

Martin, the manager, was awesome.  He took care of us and made us feel like we were regulars.   There seem to be plenty of drink specials that make this place a very good value as well.  The Boardroom is a place that any of us would definitely go back to for a game or drinks.  There's a pay parking lot right next door and the place is a block off Columbus, which is perfect for those that appreciate a low key feel.  The place had 4 flatscreens (sports), music, decent food (nachos were good), and wifi (although we couldn't get the Macs to work with it).
author: SF D.

description: Very friendly bartenders, good sports on TV, surprisingly delicious food (no offense to the establishment, but it is a bar) and nice people. Small enough to make a new bud each time you step out for a smoke break. Have a great time everytime we go.
author: Jackie B.

description: I had not heard of Woody Zip's until I went to a party there last December and it was great. I have returned a few times since then and every time it has been one of the most pleasant and all around "happy" bars I've ever been in. Not only do they have great drinks, they also have really great food. Although the lowly corn dog may not be your thig, they make a homemade corn dog that is amazing. Great place to watch a game.
author: Greg D.

description:
A classy place with friendly staff.  I haven't tried the food there yet but I've heard good things.  Reasonable prices, but the best part is the people.  Good folk and it's never too overcrowded.  I've always met very friendly people there, and the douchbag index is very low.  I'm not sure why more people don't go to this place - maybe because it's a little unassuming from the outside, but once you've been there you will definitely want to come back.

It would be great if they brought the foosball table back, but they have a dart board which is something.  All around the place has a good vibe and is very cozy.  Comfy furniture in the back so you can really chill out and relax with your friends.

Highly recommended.
author: Nilanjan N.

description: Made a quick visit this weekend for the first time to catch a bit of the UNC-Nova game.  Cool sports bar vibe going on... they've got multiple flatscreens so you've got a clear view no matter where you're sitting.  Grabbed a guiness, bartender was really quick!  Was pretty full in there, but wasn't too hard to grab a seat.  Apparently they recently started serving fried chicken and waffles.  I didn't try it, but my friend's buddy ordered it, and yeah - it looked awesome. Fried chicken and waffles and a beer? Nice.
author: Christine Y.

description: Pretty good and unassuming spot in my neighborhood. Mostly local crowd and decent selection of drinks, including some interesting tequilas and one of my favorite gins - Miller's. Still haven't been to Tuesday $2 tacos + trivia night, so might have to check that out. The only thing I can reasonably complain about are the bar stools - they are pretty damn heavy and unwieldy to sit in.
author: Andrei Z.

description: Winning the trivia match the first night we ever set foot in The Boardroom had us hooked.  Tuesday night $2 Tiger Beers also got me hooked.  A wandering dog in a bar is a good sign.  Keith is freaking awesome.
author: Natalie S.

description: Fun fun fun !!! Just ignore the drunk guy who walks around asking everyone if they want to fight and he will eventually leave you alone. Cool crowd and cheap drinks. Great place to watch a game.
author: Gene G.

description:
this place holds a special spot in my heart--it's my local tuesday trivia spot.  I've been going every tuesday for over a month, and it never disappoints.  The vibe is nice and laid back, they serve seriously delicious $2 fish tacos, and the quiz itself is just right.  not too hard, not too easy, and always enjoyable.  my ONLY only only beef is that for some reason there is ALWAYS a line for the bathroom when I want to go, but i suppose this is out of management's control short of just adding more bathrooms. ;)

props also to the bartender who joined our trivia team last week!
author: jozilla w.

description: The bartender here begs for tips when you order drinks.  Pathetic service. Patrons throwing up outside on the front steps, poor service.  Sad excuse for a bar.   Steer clear of this place.
author: steve b.

description:
so - so

jukebox didnt work - (or wasn't on), tacos were aight (i think they made me and my buddy sick that night but who knows), bartender was cool, didn't stay for trivia. even at its most packed, it didnt seem annoying so this would be a good place for a chill, relaxed night.
author: Mimi X.

description: The boardroom was okay for a birthday party. It was a fairly small venue. We luckily got a booth but the speakers were way to loud and a bit dark changing the mood of a well wanted upbeat crowd. Trivia night was a ton of fun though. The place was a no frills bar but the food for Taco Tuesdays was really good. I would go again if I wasn't right by the speakers and maybe had a seat at the bar.
author: Kalifornia S.

description: You almost wouldn't notice Woody Zips just walking by, and I even had a hard time finding it when I was actually looking for it. That just makes it all the more fun, because the people there meant to come, and have probably been there many times before. It's tiny, but the jukebox is always cranking and the bartenders are partying right along with you. A round of shots for the whole bar is a regular occurrence. Definitely a lot more character than your normal 'dive' bar, and always a wild time.
author: Kelsey S.

description:
My time I spent here was pretty mediocre, but it wasn't the bar's fault. It is a locals bar, and that's nice since I live in the area, and have had my fill of tourists at day's end. The problem being that North Beach locals and I don't have similar tastes at all. See, I am a person that will actually gravitate more toward the divey bar than the posh one. 
So, naturally I was excited by people's reviews saying it was a dive bar. When I arrived, I was reminded of why I don't fit in in North Beach. This place is NOT a dive bar, it's a cross between a neighborhood bar in a strip mall in Orange County (if those exist there) and a sports bar.
People also claim it's laid back, so I wore a nice t shirt and jeans, and felt shabby in comparison.
This was a Thursday night, and it seemed to be on fire when we arrived, about midway through, the crowd was just one group and split. I thought Thursday was the new Friday? 
So, most of the minus points are just because it wasn't my type of atmosphere, and because of the 90s corny lite rock/pop playlist. And a huge minus for the guy that turned the music off completely, then yelled for everyone to "be quiet and listen for a cellphone." Buzzkilling douche!
Plus points were having Afflingem on tap (with correct glassware), 2 dogs chasing each other across the place, and a nice bartender without 'tender 'tude.
author: Allie F.

description: Its a low key place to watch some games.  I went during NCAA tournament and everyone was very into the games which was appreciated.  Good beer, but their mixed drinks were pretty poorly made.  We had the hummus appetizer which was good.  Guy to girl ratio was as expected for a sports bar ....in san francisco :-\.
author: Marc M.

description:
I live across the street, and in the two weeks since moving here (SF) I find myself coming to Woody Zips with increasing regularity. The beers are cheap, its not obnoxiously packed (as in, screw it I don't want to force my way through a crowd to get to the bar packed) and its definitely more upscale then you usual sports bar (the artwork is a nice touch, a bit of class but without overdoing it by using real artwork, I think a Monet print would be a touch gauche here). 
On a side note: I came to SF for the first time for Fourth of July this year and stayed with a friend down the street. One of his former roommates is friends with Luke, the owner, so we watched the fireworks from the roof of Woody Zips, which was pretty damn awesome. Had some beers and food at Lukes apt as well (though I would totally not expect him to recognize me, he was basically letting us use his apartment with its roof top access, he was out of the apartment and at the bar 90% of the time, and there were lots of people there).
So yeah, good peoples and cold beverages
author: Ross G.

description: Great place, nice atmosphere.  Not your normal beer soaked sports bar.  I reccomend sampling all the great tequilas they have behind the bar and if you're an Ohio State fan the place is OFF THE HOOK on gamedays.  They also have Trumer Pilsner which is brewed in Berkeley, a super local brew that I cant find anywhere else.  The food is good too, a nice and surprising twist on normal bar food, burgers, wings...try the Black & Blue skirt steak, it's a killer!
author: Martin E.

description: First time here and I already love this place.  Not particularly close to my neighborhood but so worth the extra distance.  First of all, the people who work there were awesome and friendly.  Second, we were there for the Ohio vs. Michigan game and my husband (and son) were thrilled to see so many Buckeye fans.  Third, we only made it through the appetizer menu but it was a good indicator of how good the rest of the menu is (look forward to trying more).  And fourth, our friend who came with swears by the Hornitos margaritas.  So, good job you guys.  Keep up the good work!
author: Kirsten F.

description: Please go and get the corn dogs - they are delish. Also, possibly one of the top 5 for wings in the city.   We were in there on a sunday and it was empty and relaxing but I can definitely see going back for a game.  Thanks Keith!
author: B H.

description: I went there last friday night at 9pm. The place has four tv sets and is quite small. they do not carry heinkein(wtf). The place was empty except three guys.  If you are looking for love, this is not the place. The Stella beer is five dollars.
author: Stanley L.

description: So I normally do not hang out in North Beach--too close in proximity to the Marina.  But it's playoff season and my roommate's dad is in town from NY and we all wanted to go watch the games somewhere.  Last weekend my roommate and I went to Mad Dog and that didn't work out so well--too many soccer fans.  Like any Yelper, I searched for a good, mellow sports bar to get a burger.  Woody Zips showed up and I thought I'd give it a try.  It was great.  The staff is beyond friendly and in a very genuine way.  The TV quality and placement is key and the food is basic and good.  The burger was particularly spicy, but good spicy.  And, like my roommate's dad said, "The fries got just the right amount of too much salt."  I had a good time, just wish the game had turned out differently.
author: Sarah H.

description: Great local neighborhood sports bar. Great attitude from all the "help". Love watching Thursday night NFL games there - never over-crowded and the food is actually pretty good for bar grub. Totally recommend this place over most of the other "sports bars" in the City.
author: Scott N.

description:
FINALLY!!! MY ASU BAR!!

Somewhere in the city you'll find it. You might stumble upon it, it might take you years, but you will, and mark my words, you WILL find your sports team's bar.  For me, I've been searching since June, not too bad but it felt like eternity.  And truth be told, another ASU alum told me about this infamous ASU bar, and the ONLY one in the city.  I'm a little cautious to believe this so I still have my eyes open for another one.

The bar reminds me of ASU a lot.  Crowded, filled with beautiful people, VERY drunk beautiful people, in a dirty location.  I was so pleased to be around all the Sparky loving hotties I could care less about the dingy bar. 

I don't know about the other days, but I'll be there on Saturdays, cheering on my failing team with hope in my heart and a Bud light in my hand.
author: Carina A.

description: not a bad little spot in north beach. kitchen was already closed by the time we had got there so we weren't able to ordered the fabled bacon tater tots
author: Marty F.

description: Boardroom is a great laidback bar that provides the perfect middle-of-the-week entertainment. It is pretty much guaranteed that you will find me here on a Tuesday night for tacos and trivia. The trivia is great...a smattering of current events, some movies, random music, and photos. Not too hard or too easy. But the real surprise for me was the tacos. Boardroom has great fish tacos. Seriously. And $2 on Tuesday? Yes, please.
author: Abigail R.

description:
The boardroom instantly became one of my favorite North Beach bars, but how could I resist~ the good food, the cheap beer, the nicest bartenders ever, the well played music selection, the trivia. I really didn't think it could possibly get better, but magically it did- they added Wednesday night BINGO!! I have to say I was a little skeptical at first, but the free drink prizes along with post dance parties I haven't missed a single week.

BINGO Wednesdays can't be missed!
author: Mandy F.

description: This place is a wanna-be North Beach bar....No locals, a bunch of lame ass games to try to draw in the under age crowd, a TERRIBLE juke box,  the bar tenders are not friendly and they let their friends steal wallets off the bar.  This place needs to find a new home in the marina right under the Golden Gate.
author: J R.

description: great food, excellent bloody marys and they have been really accommodating to our CLEMSON TIGERS on gamedays. martin is the man.
author: Vinny P.

description:
Sports bar is really a misnomer here. Its a decent neighborhood bar (nothing wrong with that) that has a handful of flat screens on the walls (again, nothing wrong with that). However, thats where the sports part of the bar ends. The music is crazy loud - which isn't a bad thing on a Friday/Sat night - but if you're there midweek to watch a game, its probably not the right place if you like to listen to the game while you watch. It took me way too long to get a drink from the bartender..she was much more into chatting it up w/her friends than pouring drinks for us. Once the place emptied out a bit, the bartenders were more attentive - but by that point, we were ready to go. 

Lots of potential here. If I lived in that neighborhood, I'd probably go back again. But there's no need to make the journey to North Beach just for this place.
author: Mista Dobalina ..

description: The owner is friendly, the tacos are amazing and I hear they have bottomless mimosas on Sundays. This is a place you often see people taking shots. Pink stuff, Jager, etc. Good times here!
author: n b.

description: It's sweet.... I mean, that pretty much sums it up. It's a local bar - a rarity in the tourist infested streets of North Beach - sort of like that place where everyone knows your name. Good, strong drinks, better than average bar food (I recommend the sweet potato fries), and nice, but not too upscale (read: yuppie) decor. In my book, this place gets two thumbs up. Oh ya, and it doesn't hurt that it's close enough to stumble home if need be...
author: Jena M.

description: They've got a great trivia night on Tuesdays and some of the friendliest bartenders I've met.
author: Brian S.

description: Went there for the Niner's game on a Sunday. Decent crowd, it was thanksgiving weekend so the crowd was probably lighter than usual but the $4 bud lights and the service turned me off.  As there were only like 20 people in the bar I didn't expect to have to stand behind the bar for a couple minutes and wait for a round of beers. They do have beer + shot specials so that is a plus however overall the bar was nothing special. Good spot to watch the games and get your Sunday buzz on.
author: andrew m.

description: Best bar food in North Beach.  They just expanded the menu.  Friendly service.  And Taco Tequila Trivia Tuesday is awesome.
author: Jay F.

description: if you are in the hood and looking for nice bartenders and inexpensive drinks this is a good choice. $2 tecate! im in!
author: kenny d.

description: my friend had a guest-bartending event at the boardroom last week - i thought it was a pretty cool bar that i would go to otherwise.  definitely one star for keith, the owner, who let us have the event there and trained us on how to bartend (a skill that did NOT come easily to me whatsoever and will not develop into a new career...).  apparently they have guest-bartending on thursdays pretty often.   they also serve food there - standard bar food, the mozzarella sticks and tater-tots were good though!  the boardroom definitely has a cool atmosphere, nothing special, just a fun local bar vibe.  if you are a sports fan, they have a bunch of tv's to watch sporting events too.
author: Carolyn B.

description: i had a blast, a friendly neighborhood bar, can and does get popular, so be ready, and taco trivia tuesday is super! gonna take my girl here!
author: tim y.

description: The Tuesday Taco Trivia nights are awesome. The chicken and steak tacos are both really good, more like street tacos than anything I've had in a long time. The fish tacos are the best though -- they're $3 instead of $2 but soo good. They ran out of $2 beers this past Tuesday but I guess it doesn't hurt to not drink Tecate or Tiger for one Tuesday. Get something classy, like Budweiser. The pub quiz is really fun too except that I never know anything except for the questions about pop culture and children's books. The quiz will start late if there are good sports on (like the NBA finals). Expect to stand if you don't get here early enough because the place is really small -- I'm always jealous of the people who get the plush couches in the corner. Plus Keith, the bartender, is super nice. They're lenient on the $20 minimum for credit cards too which is nice for people like me who never make it to the ATM before these things.
author: Esther K.
